reviews.text: The Cheesecake Factory is a classic restaurant that is a great go to for families, a date, or a girl&#39;s dinner. This time around we went on a Friday night and were promptly sat to our pleasant surprise. <br><br>They immediately bring out two types of bread, white and brown, and butter. Both breads taste delicious, and obviously butter makes anything amazing. Watch yourself though because you don&#39;t want to fill up too much on the bread. <br><br>I ordered the shrimp with angel hair pasta dish. This comes as large shrimp sautéed with tomatoes, lemon, garlic, herbs and fresh basil served around/on top of a bed of angel hair pasta. I think that the proportion of the meal was a bit off -- too much pasta for the amount of shrimp/sauce given, but I was able to have leftovers. I enjoyed the meal although, in a similar way, I wish there had been more sauce for the pasta.
Great food, great service. Portions were huge and tasty as usual. And the Cinnabon Cheesecake was a slice of heaven.

We stopped in for an afternoon snack. My nieces had the original cheesecake, which was perfect as every piece of Cheesecake Factory cheesecake always is!  I had the grilled chicken lettuce tacos which is 3 grilled chicken lettuce wraps served with shreds of carrots and three different dipping sauces. Everything tasted great until I but into the wooden skewer that the chicken was grilled on. I am just thankful I didn&#39;t swallow it!  The manager and server were super apologetic, but it was still not acceptable and a careless error.

Don&#39;t know how this place is in business. I ordered food. Waited over 30 minutes for it with two hangry kids. Food came out at room temp. I sent it back. They brought it back with an apology. I grabbed my plate and burnt my hand. Thanks.

I got a mojito from the happy hour menu for $6.50, it was probably the best mojito I have ever had, excellent flavoring at the right balance and a great strength for the money.<br><br>I also ordered the chicken fettuccini which was very flavorful. My only complaint with it was that there was very few pieces of chicken (4 bite sized pieces) and the cost to add chicken is a good jump for the little chicken you do get. I also would have loved if the sauce thickened up but it stayed watery.<br><br>Why the two stars? They lost my credit card! I take blame for accidentally leaving my card in my bill. I went there the next day and the bartender confirmed I had left it. He did the responsible thing and passed it to a manager, well apparently that manager doesn&#39;t know where it went. I had to go in twice and call in order to get updates even after being told they would contact me. I don&#39;t know how you lose people&#39;s card but it seems shady. So overall good food but pay with cash. Like stated I do take blame for leaving it originally but for them to admit they had my card and just couldn&#39;t find it isnt reasonable to me.

Well, the food is good. I am writing a one-star review purely for attitude and that I will not order from this Cheesecake Factory again.<br><br>Ordered this through DoorDash. There was no bread included. I asked for extra butter for the bread. I go butter, no bread. <br><br>Not that big of a deal, and by the way, it&#39;s not a DoorDash issue since the bread comes in the sealed bag. <br><br>So I call to tell them that they gave me butter and no bread. Didn&#39;t really seem to care, just reminded me the bread is complementary. So, I guess The Cheesecake Factory would like everyone to know NOT to expect any bread. I like the bread. This is part of my reason for ordering food from here. But since the bread shouldn&#39;t be expected (apparently) and these guys don&#39;t really care, I will order from another restaurant from now on.

I stopped by for a late lunch on the weekday and the restaurant was fairly empty. I was craving pizza and got the combo with the salad. The pizza crust was pretty hard, not what I remember from visits to other cheesecake factories. I tried some of my friends fish and chips and that was delicious! <br><br>We were at the restaurant towards shift change and the waitress was a bit frantic and rushed to get us served and bring us the bill because it had been a slow day. We ended up paying and going to the counter to order our dessert to bring home. The carrot cake was extremely moist but very frosting heavy. I&#39;d definitely recommend sharing it with a few people. <br><br>Overall, it&#39;s a convenient place in the inner harbor to stop by for a quick meal.

It&#39;s kinda hard to imagine not enjoying yourself at a Cheesecake Factory, right?! They&#39;re freaking delicious and usually pretty consistent in whatever state, whatever location you go to...but this one definitely misses the mark.<br><br>I&#39;d like to think a big problem is this location of the restaurant. It&#39;s in an older building in downtown inner harbor and when you walk in, you&#39;re hit with these really gross...sewage smell? Or gas leak smell? Or both? Smells like something is definitely up with their plumbing system and it hits you hella hard when you walk in, and are being seated. Even when I was eating my food I could smell it, it&#39;s just a very unpleasant funky smell that I have never ever smelled in any other location.<br><br>Secondly, they don&#39;t give you bread or even offer. You have to remember to ask. The food is alright, except my succatash was so charred that all I could taste was dried out burnt veggies :( Thats the first time that&#39;s ever happened. It just look like someone completely forgot about my poor veggies for 20 mins then said &#34;oh well&#34; and dished it up on my plate. My chicken and potatoes were fine though, standard to any other location and enjoyable. <br><br>Service is very meh. Hard to ask for drink refills, bread, wasn&#39;t offered dessert. Kinda disappointing but not the worst thing about the experience. <br><br>I think my biggest takeaway from this experience was that this place kinda smells like a dirty diaper and I just can&#39;t get over it. I&#39;m sitting here writing this review and I just...wish y&#39;all could smell this because you&#39;d be like &#34;you&#39;re right Adri, this place smells nasty and your poor review is well deserved!
I love cheesecake factory! Food is great, especially the bread. I also enjoy their happy hour deals. The service at the inner harbor location is a bit slow though. Still a huge fan of all locations.

Our experience here was all around bad for such a large and reputable chain. The only saving grace was the pineapple upside down cheesecake, which was excellent. It was not too sweet, it was creamy, flavorful and well crafted. It also brought attention to what you should expect from this national chain. It highlighted the flaws for what you pay. We were a party of 5 (3 adults and 2 toddlers). They had us seated within the 30minutes they gave us. The waitress seemed so rushed even when taking the drink orders. Maybe it was our small talk as we ordered, in an effort to lighten her energy. It took about 45 minutes for our food to come out. The food was bland and Luke warm. We would have sent it back but was concerned that our wait time would have suffered. <br>Probably our last visit to aCheesecake Factory unless we are in the mood for dessert.

First time ordering online and having it delivered with DoorDash. A few minutes after placing the order we realized we forgot Cheesecake!! So I called to see if we could ad it. The young lady said she had no idea and had to ask the bakery. She came back and said no. I asked if that was something you had to contact DoorDash for?  She told me she had no idea never have used it and she didn&#39;t know anything about it. Ok forget the Cheesecake. Lol <br>Portions are always huge at Cheesecake Factory. We ordered the Crusted Chicken Romano. I asked for extra sauce for each dish. Check out the picture. It&#39;s a 4oz container. It might have had a spoonful in each container. We were also missing our bread. So I called and asked for a manager to clarify the procedure if you need to ad something and if we were suppose to have bread. So yes you do have to contact Door Dash. Which still doesn&#39;t make sense to me because you&#39;re ordering it from Cheesecake Factory website. They forgot our bread. ‍<br>You let me down Cheesecake Factory.

I love the Cheesecake Factory but I was highly disappointed with the hostess and other servers in this restaurant. <br>We were seated quickly, no wait. Our server was quick to get us our drinks and bread. She took our order quickly, took over an hour to get our food. <br>The other servers were rude when we trying to get by to the restroom, no excuse me or apology when they bumped into us. <br>I quite disappointed with this restaurant. <br>Overall our server was wonderful, polite and took care of us. Shout out to Sarah for being an awesome server. She&#39;s was exceptionally

This place is packed anytime. Make sure to plan ahead for reservations or whatever! I sat outside with only one waiter and expected nada. Food came out in 15 minutes for two which was surprisingly suspicious.<br>Only saw the server to take our order, bring food, and to give the check. And this was at 8 on Saturday. Still no excuse to be busy!<br>It&#39;s a good place to go for a nice bite to eat with a casual family dinner, date, etc. but nothing fancy.

I like Cheesecake Factory, but this location is very inconsistent. I go because I like CF food, and sometimes this is just the most convenient location. I&#39;ve visited probably ~8 times in the last 2 years. <br><br>The wait time has been double what was quoted for the past 2 visits (once on a weekday and once on a Saturday at 4pm). The weekday wait was supposedly 35-40 minutes but ended up being 75. The nicer manager at the time gave my table free appetizers, so I wasn&#39;t too upset in the end. The second time, I was quoted 25-30 minutes and it was nearly an hour before we had a table. In general, organization is poor and some of the servers are quite brusque. Many times I end up having to sit uncomfortably close to people at other tables.  <br><br>During a torrential downpour, a hostess unprofessionally called out to the people in the waiting area, asking per manager if anyone wanted to sit outside in the &#34;covered&#34; area for faster service. She walked us over to take a look, and the &#34;wall&#34; flaps of the tent was wildly flapping in the wind, with rain clearly hitting all of the tables outdoors...seriously? I&#39;m not sure why the manager would even suggest putting people outside in a monsoon. <br><br>Today I had a nice young man as a server, and he made the experience much more pleasant than usual. I LOVED the loaded baked potato soup that he suggested--it was so rich and hearty. <br><br>Sometimes the bread is stale, but other times it&#39;s hot and fresh. There&#39;s really no telling. Today it was fresh. <br><br>My usual dish is the pasta carbonara. I tried to seen if the farfalle dish would be a better version of the carbonara because it has chicken, tomatoes, and mushrooms in addition to the bacon and peas. It wasn&#39;t as great as I hoped. The sauce was more watery compared to the original carbonara and there were only like 5 pieces of chicken and a few pieces of pancetta. I definitely will stick to the regular pasta carbonara from now on. <br><br>Pineapple chicken was very sweet and very crispy. the brown rice was thoroughly cooked.

We ate here for dinner on a Friday. It was fairly crowded but we were able to get a seat immediately. We had the mini crab bites for an appetizer. Those were very tasty and had a nice crunch to the exterior. For meals, I had the steak Diane. It was very under seasoned and didn&#39;t have much flavor at all. The meat seemed like they hadn&#39;t seasoned it at all. My husband had the gumbo, which he enjoyed but didn&#39;t think it was reminiscent of gumbo. Service was fairly good but it seemed like they were probably understaffed. So, nothing horrible but nothing great.

I ordered a pizza for delivery. It arrived packaged in a plastic container, like the kind a salad would be packaged in. It had been folded to fit inside the box. The part that was folded was completed ruined as the toppings had come off and the parts that weren&#39;t folded had the cheese slide down and collect in the center. <br><br>I called and the manager explained that they were out of boxes. Horrible excuse. If I had been alerted that there proper packing was not available I would have gladly ordered something else. <br><br>No thanks.

I have been to Cheesecake Factory countless times, it&#39;s a standard chain restaurant that&#39;s present in most cities. This particular experience was one of the worst I have had. When we arrived we were quoted a wait of 20- 30 min, which is fine, but then it actually turned into an almost hour wait. If we had know it would have been an hour we would have gone elsewhere. Then once we were finally sat, it took whoever was helping us another 20 minutes to bring us bread which they usually bring once you sit. I understand bread has to be made, but that wasn&#39;t the case here because other tables were being served bread. The rest of the experience  was pretty standard. Cheesecake Factory has a pretty extensive menu with lots of options for vegetarians. I have got the 4 cheese pasta and have tried the veggie burger before, both which tasted good. They also have a wide selection of cheesecakes which are really good.

About a month ago my husband and I had dinner here. We like the Cheesecake Factory and happened to be in town so we decided to go. We were told there was a 10 minute wait, but were seated in just a few minutes.  It was very prompt.  <br>Our waitress greeted us with in a few minutes, but seemed a bit irritated we werent ready to order as soon as she dropped our water. Pretty soon we ordered, I got the Chicken Avocado Club and He ordered a sandwich as well. He and I were talking about how it seemed like a long time and the manager over heard us. He came over and apologized and said he would make sure they were right out. During this time our waitress seemed to have completely disappeared. When she did stop by she never mentioned the status of things or offered an explanation. <br>It took 35 minutes for the entrees. There was no visit from the manager again, no discount and honestly I feel like 35 minutes is way to long to wait for 2 sandwiches.<br>We have been to this location more than once and while the food is good the service has never been good. <br>Make sure you leave plenty of time if you are going to dine here.

I came with my girlfriend to this location on 2/17/2019 for lunch. We were extremely disappointed at how long the wait was when we arrived, however, we were told that the bar area was first come first serve seating so we headed into that direction. <br><br>I gave this Cheesecake Factory location two stars because while the food was alright, the service was eh. <br><br>See attached photo... I ordered the Four Cheese Lunch Pasta with Chicken which is my go to pasta at any Cheesecake Factory Location. I will say that I was a little disappointed that I was told they could not give me Pesto with the pasta because they don&#39;t have Pesto, but I&#39;ve had it before. The dish was great and super filling! <br><br>The service wasn&#39;t great! The people working in the bar area (behind the bar or in the high top area) would scream at each other from across the room. Our waitress rarely came to our table and took forever to even come and give us a menu and take our order. <br><br>I don&#39;t think that I would come back to this location as it was more disappointing than it was pleasing.
One of my go-to places. Love the chicken piccata and I always ask for extra lemon sauce with my dish and they happily oblige.

With traveling for work I&#39;ve been almost  everywhere. Whenever I found a  cheesecake factory there was consistently a good meal with a variety of cooking styles to choose from. So an easy choice on the road.<br><br> However there is a stark difference at this location that drags the name through the mud. Overly long waits ,inattentive staff poorly cooked meals. This will definitely make me hesitate revisit future unknown venues.<br><br>I will not go here again.

Service: 3<br>Cleanliness: 3<br>Food: 4<br>Beer Selection: 1<br>Overall: 3<br>Comment: After reading the reviews I was a little hesitant to stop in. But, I hadn&#39;t been to a Cheesecake factory in years so I thought I check it out. The place was very busy so I sat at the bar. The bartender (Kelsey) was very friendly and helpful. She greeted me with 5 minutes and my food came in about ten. I had the chicken salad sandwich and it was very good. Big chucks of chicken and flavorful. Unfortunately, they only had two craft beers on tap which was a disappointment. Overall, the food and service were was good and I have no complaints.

Stayed in the hotel across the street and stopped in for cheesecake. The ladies handling that to go counter at the cheesecake section were fantastic! Very fun upbeat and professional plus my cheesecake was top notch. I was in and out in less than five minutes despite super long lines waiting for the dining room :-)

I always had great feelings about Cheesecake Factory and after my visit this weekend I am starting to feel eh.  This is where I also wish I could give half stars.  I think this place is a solid 3.5.  I rounded down because A 4 definitely wouldn&#39;t represent the sigh I felt dining here.  Came here for lunch and drinks with friends and were seated right away which was great.  The menu is Huge!  There is so much to choose from.  Something for everyone.  They now list the calories of all of their menu items which makes it good for those who are watching what they eat but man it made me sad.  Because looking at the menu and seeing what I would have chosen thinking it wasn&#39;t that bad of a choice and then seeing the calories next to it was disheartening.  I mean so many single menu items had more than a days worth of calories!  And I hadn&#39;t even gotten to the cheesecake!  So after struggling with that I chose my lunch off of the very extensive &#34;skinny&#34; menu.  I had the taquitos and a Greek salad.  The prices for those items were reasonable but they were definitely small plates.  Which was fine for me and within a reasonable calorie range.  I also ordered a pineapple Moscow mule which was served in a tall glass and tasted like chemical pineapple.  It was pretty sweet too.  There were no prices on the drinks.  The price for it? $12!!  My friend ordered a Tito&#39;s and soda.  $9?!  It&#39;s a chain! I know it&#39;s inner harbor but I think that&#39;s not an inner harbor thing.  That&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory thing.  <br>So I spent about $30 for me to eat a snack and a chemical drink.  I was sad about my fear of eating what I want based on seeing how many calories things there really had and left hungry and poor.  <br>In other news service was good and the atmosphere was bright.  Cheesecakes looked so good but I&#39;ll probably never eat one since one slice is like 2 days of calories for me.

I just received my order via door dash. I have TWO pieces of chicken. I asked in the order for them to add feta cheese and they drop THREE small pieces of feta crumbles. Look at the photo. I cannot believe that someone poured a bunch of noodles and sauce in a to go container and thought that was acceptable.
Ok you said contact u on ur website but I do not see general question anywhere on the website given to me.

First time at cheesecake.<br>This location appears older?<br>Table dirty, cutlery not clean on the table.<br>The Santa Fe salad was very good, Fettuccini also tasty.<br>The actual cheesecake, excellent.<br>Biggest challenge at this location; staff was yelling loudly to one another, dropping F bombs, very poor management allowing this.  Also an expensive meal, no drinks, 1 order of cheesecake; 60 bucks.

I recently placed a lunch order via Door Dash at Cheesecake Factory for a Cobb salad. My total came to about $17. So of course I&#39;m thinking I&#39;m going to get a nice hearty Cobb salad upon arrival. Unfortunately I was quickly disappointed (please see photo). My salad contained 98% mixed greens and recalled romaine lettuce. The remainder of the 2% includes some bacon bits, 3 chicken pieces, and barely 1 piece of avocado (which I had to shake up to find).<br>According to the description of a Cobb salad on their website it should include tomato, egg, blu cheese, bacon, chicken, and avocado. I received barely a portion what Cheesecake Factory describes as a Cobb salad. <br>I am highly disappointed and still soooooo hungry . I would not recommend ordering from Cheesecake Factory. Door Dash did give me credits but this issue is with Cheesecake Factory. Please be careful ordering Salmonella Salads

We arrived and told the receptionist we were a party of 6 and chose to be seated outdoors. We were told the wait would be an hour to an hour and 45 minutes. We waited the hour and due to rain we went back inside and asked for a table indoors. And were told our table would be ready in 15 minutes. But those 15 minutes came and went. We saw another party of 6 get seated. We saw a bunch of smaller parties of 3 or 4 get seated and still we waited. We spoke with the receptionist multiple times in which she stated they were seating smaller parties cause of the smaller tables available. Which we understand. We asked about the larger party that had just arrived and was seated immediately but we still waited and all she said was that our table wasn&#39;t ready. 2 and a half ours later we left. 2 hungry kids and 4 hungry adults settled for something else because of some bullshit customer service in which a party that arrives after we&#39;ve already been waiting gets seated while we still wait. Never again. If I could leave 0 stars for customer service I would.

I have eaten at several Cheesecake Factory&#39;s - not one location has ever disappointed. Food is always great and satisfying. At this location, the hostess and server were great and very hospitable. Because of Halloween, my dish was plated like a spider; clever and fun. It was quite tasty.

I wish I could give this restaurant more stars. I came here on a first date with a friend at the time four years ago. This past week, I came back to this restaurant looking to propose to her. Melissa (the front end manager on duty) went above and beyond to accommodate my request. I talked to her 2 days before I planned to propose to come up with a plan. I told her this is where we came for our first date 4 years ago and I pointed out where we sat for our first date. Melissa was able to lay out a great game plan on how to make that moment special. From the moment we walked in, Melissa put the plan in action and everything was just as we pictured.<br><br>We came during lunch time to avoid the larger crowd. My server was amazing, and made the nerve-wracking experience of proposing very easy. The food was great. Amazing portion sizes for the lunch menu. <br><br>I can&#39;t say thank you enough to Melissa and the staff for their kind words after the proposal. This restaurant and staff made the moment very special and something we will remember for the rest of our lives.

Worst experience ever. Phoned in order for pickup. Ordered a Cobb Salad with a slice of strawberry cheesecake and Strawberry Lemonade to drink. Didn&#39;t check order until I&#39;d gotten back to my hotel. The attached receipt said &#34;Chopped Salad&#34;. Lots of chopped lettuce with some crumbled blue cheese and bacon, but absolutely no avocado, red onions, and very little chicken. It had APPLES in it!! Blasphemy. Thank goodness for the &#34;dressing on the side&#34;. I specifically asked for bread and butter. Got none. Finally, there was NO cheesecake. What a disappointment. You know how you&#39;re anxiously waiting to eat something you&#39;ve been dreaming about? That was me. Based on this experience, I doubt that I will ever go to this CF location again.
The pasta was more salty than it wa she fire and we complained, the manager was super mean and rude to us.

ABSOLUTELY THE WORST experience I&#39;ve ever had! The service was absolutely TERRIBLE! Our waitress was very rude, every time we&#39;d ask for something she&#39;s basically throw it in our face. When I got my Breakfast Burrito, the cheese tasted funny. It had like a rotten taste and when I ask for it to be redone, my waitress gave an attitude. Then the manager came over to our table and asked &#34;Burrito? What&#39;s the issue?&#34; She was rude and gave me attitude as well. She said they checked the cheese and everything was up to date. Her tone &amp; attitude were basically calling me a lair. I asked her to have my burrito remade w/out any cheese. Will definitely be calling higher mgmt. I hate leaving bad reviews but this place really deserved it. Extremely disappointed.

So our food was delicious and my rating in no way reflects the cooks. Tonight we had potstickers, white chicken chili and a lemon garlic pasta with asparagus from their skinnylicious menu. <br><br>I&#39;m giving this location 3 stars for the service as well as our general experience while dining in the restaurant tonight. Firstly, it took about 30 minutes for us to just get bread. That doesn&#39;t include putting in our order for the food! I&#39;m not sure if it was because our waitress was actually that busy but on the couple of occasions when she passed by our table, we said excuse me more than once and she continued walking! I had to sort of yell excuse me to grab her attention. Pretty absolute that she heard us. Lastly, while we were leaving, one of the waitresses by the door yelled to the hostess &#34;don&#39;t send anyone else over to this section!&#34; Right in front of us which was super unprofessional. <br><br>We love Cheesecake Factory but I think we&#39;ll just stick to the Towson location going forward. We always have a great experience while we&#39;re there and we also don&#39;t have to worry about paying for parking. We paid $29 tonight just to park, yikes!!!
I love cheesecake factory but then again who doesn&#39;t ??????? Macaroni balls are the bomb dot com
Worst cheesecake I&#39;ve ever had. I eat the same cheesecake from the Cheesecake Factory every time I visit and this location takes the cake as the absolute worst.

If I could leave a negative review I would!!!  I have never had a more horrible experience in my entire life!!!<br><br>After waiting for OVER an hour and a half for a table and being told twice that they were clearing our table and after another 20 minutes we finally got sat. As we were being seated we walked by tons of dirty tables. It was absolutely ridiculous!!!! I asked to speak with management and the manager didn&#39;t seem to care. While we waited I went to the restroom and it was littered with paper towels all over the place. As we continued to wait, the kitchen staff and waitstaff started cussing and dropping the F-word, S-word, D-word, etc. SEVERAL TIMES THE F-WORD was used. I have never been more appalled in my life. This was the worst visit to Cheesecake Factory that has ever been, and it shall be my last!!!  <br><br>I would strongly suggest going somewhere else to dine. This place was awful!!! ABSOLUTELY AWFUL!!!  Consumer beware!!

I&#39;ve never been to a Cheesecake Factory before, but was curious after hearing good things from my girlfriend and friends.  We arrived to this location right when it opened. We were seated promptly, but it took over 10 minutes for our server to even acknowledge our existence and take our drink orders. Throughout the meal my glass of water was never refilled. I&#39;m honestly surprised that the service would be as slow as it was considering we were in the heart of the Inner Harbor in Baltimore. <br><br>I ordered the chicken parmesan and gf ordered the Mac &amp; cheese and mashed potatoes. Chicken parmesan was very cheesy :), but the chicken base was not very tasty :(; they basically took a whole bunch of overly processed chicken and pressed it to make a thin pizza crust.  Pasta on top was bland and had no flavor. Mac &amp; cheese was similar; flavor was bland and cheese was soupy at the bottom. Mashed potatoes were also average. <br><br>I will say that the portions are very American (ie, huge!). I wanted to order cheesecake but was already full from the meal (but also disappointed at the meal and didn&#39;t want to risk spending money on cheesecake).  If I came here again it would just be to order dessert. Not sure what the hype is about this place.

Terrible. I love cheesecake factory but do not come to the one in Baltimore. It is super dirty. I had to ask for plastic utensils. There were nats everywhere, one even landed on my food. The picture is the nats on the wall where we were sitting. When I complained to the manager, he apologized and asked us if we wanted to sit somewhere else, but we were already leaving.<br>I ordered a chicken carbonara, which is my favorite and the pasta was drenched in water, it almost looked like a soup. Not happy at all. I&#39;m very sad, because cheesecake factory is usually my favorite.
Excellent nt food-sweet tamales, calamari, Louisiana chicken, shepherds pie-all good.
One of my favorite restaurants the four cheese pasta is my favorite. The bread was fresh and the cheesecake was delicious as always

Only came for coffee and Desserts. Both were terrible. Large amounts of coffee grounds in the coffee. We ordered 4 desserts, one cheesecake had a long piece of hair, and the rest were just sub par. Service was ok, but I wouldn&#39;t waste your time here.

The location and patio right on the harbor. That&#39;s why you come here. <br><br>It&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory. You know what you&#39;re getting when you go to one of these. We needed a late dinner spot and opted for this because of the massive menu. It can be overwhelming. If you can&#39;t find something on this menu you like, well then you may be the problem. My sister got pasta, the nieces a veggie burger and crab cakes, and I went with the Renee&#39;s Special (Half sammie, soup, and salad). It was all fine and did the job. Maggie loved her veggie burger, which is a big deal because she is super picky. <br><br>Our server was really friendly. After a long travel day for our group, it was a nice relaxing dinner and just what we needed.

It was my first time at a cheesecake factory and even though it was very very busy they handled the service like pros. The food was great( didnt expect less considering people always say the food at cheesecake factory is good) and the cheesecake was fantastic. William S. was our server and he was great. Didn&#39;t bother us constantly but was always attentive and just there when we needed him.

After so many disappointing meals in the area this one was a much needed treat.   The setting was comfortable the dining staff was fun and informative .    As always I ask what is a favorite of my server and generally go with their suggestion .     So many choices to shoes from I went with her 1-3 suggestions.  Outstanding service.  Outstanding and flavorful food.   Highly recommended

Probably the best dining in experience I have had at this particular Cheesecake Factory out of the 3 times I&#39;ve been here. Food was great and the service was awesome. I think the experience being so great was solely on our server Antonio. He was attentive and courteous and personable. Big thing with me is I don&#39;t drink drinks like a normal person and he kept our drinks filled at all times. Awesome experience.

I don&#39;t normally go to restaurants after seeing lots of bad reviews, but I haven&#39;t been to The Cheesecake Factory in over 6 yrs so I thought I would try and see for myself.  I&#39;ll start with the good,  lot of reviews mention  bad customer service, for me this was not the case.  My server  was Tiona and she was awesome, I didn&#39;t have long to wait, she was fast with my orders, brought my drink and the bread very quickly and checked back to see how everything was with my meal. The Korean Fried Cauliflower was delicious and just the right amount for an appetizer.  I wish I had stopped at this time, but didn&#39;t.  Now for the bad which is why only 3 stars, my main dish wasn&#39;t as good as it used to be in fact it was borderline bad.  I had the Chinese Chicken Salad, it used to be so good now it just looks sad. It&#39;s so bad it&#39;s sad!  There was hardly any chicken, which in hindsight should have been a good thing since it tasted like deli sliced  lunch meat, it used to have chunks of chicken, this chicken was very thin slices that tasted frozen.  The dressing had a weird acidic taste, and the salad just looked droopy.  It used to come with a mound of noodles now there were so few I almost couldn&#39;t find them. I saved my cheesecake for later, but it was delicious as always, hence the 3 stars.  Five for service and 2.5 for food since 2 things were  great

We went for an early dinner and were seated right away.  Our server was very nice.  The food was as expected from The Cheesecake Factory.   We got the banana cheesecake for dessert and it was delicious!

I love the Cheesecake Factory back home where I&#39;m from, so I decided to try the one in Baltimore. Giving this three stars because the food was just okay, and the service was also just okay. However... did find a hair in my Korean fried cauliflower. Sent it back and got it comped but kind of ruined my appetite.

After having lunch, I walked into the Cheesecake Factory for dessert.<br><br>The service here was not amazing. The staff was nice and professional, but getting my cheesecake and subsequently getting my bill was much slower than I expected.<br><br>I decided to get the Fresh Strawberry Cheesecake. It was their most popular menu item and also something that I thought would taste nice, so I also really wanted to try it. On their menu, it said &#34;The Original Topped with Glazed Fresh Strawberries. Our Most Popular Flavor for Over 35 Years!&#34;. This cheesecake was amazing. It was creamy, rich in flavour, had just the right amount of sweetness, and tasted amazing. The strawberries also tasted nice.<br><br>Overall, I am glad I came here.

I receive some of the worst service of my life at this restaurant. I order food, they got it incorrect, in waited wholly ten entire table ate to still not receive my food. Worst service ever. NEVER EAT HERE!

Celebrated my birthday here this year. Good service and they were pretty quick for serving over ten people. I personally didn&#39;t like the red velvet cheesecake. They white chocolate raspberry is the best cheesecake there. <br>The bread and the butter are good too. <br>The waiters were all really nice and welcoming.
Great service but the don&#39;t know what 6ft is. They sit other near each other less than six feet. CDC should really look into This place!

Just went for my sons birthday to eat and they were very clean and following the social distancing rules. The waitress was very nice and the food was awesome as usual. We sat with views to the harbor and there was a great breeze. We will be back. :)

This Cheesecake Factory had great staff. They sang happy birthday and all which I didn&#39;t know they did. All the food ways really good except the appetizer which we had the crab and artichoke dip with bread and the bread was burnt and extremely hard. Other than that the service and food was great.

Coming from someone who has been to multiple different locations; I strongly advise to avoid the Baltimore Cheesecake Factory. While the place has been relatively empty, my family was placed in the back corner where it was pretty cold at best. We waited over an hour to receive our food and once the food arrived my fettuccini Alfredo was also cold. Thinking the server would come back and ask how the food was, I waited before starting to eat. After no server or anyone else stopped over to check how our food was I decided to eat it anyways. No one came back for another 20 minutes to which I mentioned my dissatisfaction before paying. They did not care, the server said it was fine when the food came out so she doesn&#39;t believe this was the case. Finally they removed the Alfredo but ultimately I would not recommend coming here under any circumstances.

The food was amazing! The Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp was very tasteful and the portion was very large. I also ordered two Strawberry Martinis that were DELICIOUS. <br>My only concern was the the woman who we were led to so she can seat us. While we were standing there she was cursing to another coworker about an incident that happened. Extremely unprofessional! She could care less about the customers standing there.
Terrible service.....sat there for two hours and left. The highlight of the trip was getting the bread about 45 minutes into the fiasco...dirty plates, awful service, and no food

So this is the first CF that I&#39;ve ever been to. And I&#39;ve come here a lot . I was meeting a vegan friend for lunch and figured this would be a good place because of the extensive menu. <br><br>The waitress was attentive<br><br>Food:<br><br>My salad was weird. The greens were fresh but the cucumber was not fresh and wilted<br><br>Crab cake bites- Not good. I would never order again. And though they are on the small plates menu, they really should be ashamed about the 6 super tiny quarter sized crab cake bites they serve. I believe they should give you a few more . <br><br>Sweet potato fries - they were ok<br><br>The best part of the meal were the Korean fried cauliflower that i tried. The sweet and spicy sauce was delicious. The cauliflower were fried hard and just really very good!<br><br>One of the problems with CF that I&#39;ve noticed throughout the years is that it is very inconsistent.. This meal wasn&#39;t great but another day, it could be delicious.. Just never know <br><br>Sorry, no pictures this day!

After a beautiful day at the aquarium, my husband an i decided to grab dinner at this cheesecake location. We&#39;re both fans of CF as well. Upon entering, the host who was friendly and prompt, directed us to our table. After being seated, our waitress came and took drink orders but did not offer any waters. We had to ask for it. We also had to ask for our bread and silverware(after we ordered our apps). The Mac n cheese bites were good but cool in the middle. Before we got the apps my husband already sent back his drink (mojito) after receiving it in a dirty glass. Finally we order our entrees, he got the Louisiana pasta and i got the pasta di Vinci with an addition of steak. While my husbands food came out correctly, mine did not. There was no steak. I was willing to just take it as is but the pasta it self was not to par. I instead just changed my order to the NY bone in steak with mash and Mac. A manager came out and assured that my food would be out quickly. Needless to say, the steak was not  up to par as well. The Mac was very undercooked. As if they just threw the cheese on there. The mash potatoes has a sweet taste to it as if a little sugar was added and was very bland. Through out this ordeal, the waitress who was kind, didn&#39;t offer much help. I asked to speak to a manager and when he came, instead of talking with me or offering some sort of comp, he focused on the fact that i said the mash potatoes were bland and &#34;tells&#34; me &#34;oh honey, all out mash potatoes and made with butter and heavy cream.&#34; Instead of working with the guest to ensure that we enjoyed ourselves i got attitude. I myself have been in the food service industry for 10 years and as a bar manager who was once a server and bartender, i have NEVER shown the type of unprofessionalism that I&#39;ve seen here. Great day, ruined by bad management.

Went last week with my husband for a weekend getaway. Our waitress was Janee. She was all around amazing! I was feeling a little off because of my pregnancy and her hospitality honestly made me feel better. She made sure I had cold water the whole time and didn&#39;t rush me or my husband when we couldn&#39;t figure out what to get. Her knowledge of the menu and recommendations based off what we told her we like helped alot. She showed she wasn&#39;t just a waitress there for the money. <br><br>Overall the food was THE BEST, and Janee made the whole experience just all around warm and comfortable. Im already planning my next trip and will be calling to make sure I have her again.

This is my favorite place to eat when I&#39;m in the Inner Harbor area. You definitely get the bang for your buck! At my most recent visit, I ordered the Chicken Bellagio, which featured breaded chicken over spaghetti pasta in a buttery sauce with arugula salad on top. The dish was flavorful and honestly 2 meals in one. We also ordered the chicken samosas as an  appetizer (technically, it&#39;s considered a &#34;small plate&#34; instead of a full blown appetizer...perfect serving size for two people!) and they were wonderfully seasoned, slightly spicy, and fall apart in your mouth delicious! <br><br>For dessert of course, you HAVE to try their cheesecake. They serve at least 30 different kinds and they have plenty of gluten/sugar free options. I usually go for the classic original, but this time I was adventurous and tried the tuxedo (chocolate mousse, mascarpone cheese, chocolate fudge) and would highly recommend it for all chocolate lovers! Be wary that the cheesecake slices are huge and can easily be split between two people.

I had a horrible experience for a birthday celebration at this restaurant not only did the waiter (Barry) lie in my face more than once. I asked him if they do anything for birthday and he told me no so I had to go ask about worker because I knew that was a lie. But he also was very rude. He also never returned my debit card, when I came in the next morning. I spoke with the manager on and he refused to check the black books to see if maybe my card was there. Even though I was patient and asked him that since I traveled here it would be appreciated if he could please check. He told me that he will speak with the waiter who wasn&#39;t in today and they will give me a call but anything I suggested he shot down.<br>I am very disappointed and will not be returning to this restaurant  again the food was not satisfying horrible service and this was all for a birthday celebration.

Dinner for 3! Visiting the area, seeing the sights and checking out the local casinos and needed sustenance. This restaurant sits on the inner harbor unfortunately we were not placed where we had a view. This restaurant is typical of other Cheesecake Factory Restaurants with the exception of the view. Excellent food and good service.

We arrived and our party of three were given a buzzer and told it would be 10 minutes. We went in the bar area and noticed several tables empty but not cleared from the prior dinners. <br>There were French fries and trash all over the floor.<br>Once seated I put my hands on the table and it was so sticky we just got up and left.<br>Disgusting place.

When I got there to get my take out at the cheesecake counter the young woman was taking selfies with a young man. She continued on her conversation for literally 5 minutes with him behind the counter and they continued to take selfies together. She didn&#39;t greet me all this time. Excuse me I said but she put her finger up and continued on. At this point I had already paid online and though I was annoyed I just wanted to get my food and leave. When I got home on top of the terrible service I found not 1 not 2 but 3 long jet black hairs in my pasta. I really wasn&#39;t going to even waste my time and write a review but then I called to complain and the woman put me on hold for 30 min I was never able to speak to a manager. This particular Cheesecake factory is a mess. Don&#39;t waste your time or money.

Worst service ever....my daughter&#39;s black beans had a melted plastic lid in the bowl. When mentioned to the manager, he replied &#34;this happens all the time due to the location of the plastic lids&#34;. Waitress introduced herself then we didn&#39;t see her for a time and when she returned asked if we were ready to order. Never checked in on us throughout our meal. Of note, the establishment was not that busy and it&#39;s probably due to how economically  depressing the inner harbor has become. As I digress, I must mention that the scooters people need designated riding lanes.

Early Dinner Date -_-<br><br>My boyfriend and I came here on a very busy Sunday; I think there was a cheer leading competition or something. As soon as we walked in there was people everywhere waiting to be seated and we thought to ourselves oh boy! We went to the hostess stand and asked how long the wait would be and she said 30-40 minutes. Mind you we haven&#39;t ate all day and we were starving. We decided to wait the awful long 30 minutes. I manage to look around the bar area to see if there was seats for us.<br><br>One couple finally got up and we took their place. We was excited and starving. Our waiter cleaned off our table and gave us some water to start off with. We had a while to look over the menu since it was super busy there. We decided on two small plates; stuffed mushrooms and chicken samosas. The chicken samosa was pretty good and the sauce that came with it was amazing; it gave it an extra zest to it. The stuffed mushrooms was okay, I was expecting a more explosion in my mouth; I love stuffed mushrooms but this one was okay :(<br><br>We both ordered Cajun Jambalaya Pasta which we normally don&#39;t do. We tend to ordered different items to try each other entrees however; it sounded delicious! The presentation was beautiful however; the taste was very bland. You will need to add a lot of salt to the noodles. The chicken and shrimp was okay; plus the tomatoes was good too. The fettuccine pasta had regular pasta and green pasta. If you get this meal don&#39;t expect to be WOW by it. We was highly dissapointed! I would not recommend this entree. We literally ate the shrimp and chicken and a little bit of pasta and was done.<br><br>Now on to the desert; we are Oreo lovers so of course we ordered the Oreo cheesecake. I have to say the Oreo cheesecake was the best part of our entire meal and that&#39;s just sad. We didn&#39;t finish it all due to being over stuffed and it being extremely fating haha.<br><br>Our overall experience was okay, the server was very attentive; I forgot her name but she was nice and pleasant. I would come here again when it&#39;s not busy. This was my boyfriend first time at this particular location and he wasn&#39;t  impressed. Out first date was at Cheesecake Factory in Arundle Mills :)

Today was one of my worst customer services experiences, ever!!! Went to this location for dessert, but when I arrived at the dessert station there was one person there preparing orders. She called for the cashier and then told me that she was on the other side. Five minutes later, I caught the manager&#39;s attention and told him that I had been waiting for at least five minutes for someone to take my order. He apologized and called the cashier. She walked over to the cash register going off about how whoever said they were waiting for five minutes had been lying. She was not aware that I made the complaint. So again, before she asked what I wanted she said, &#34;I&#39;m sorry but someone was out here lying saying they had been waiting for five minutes.&#34; I informed her that I made the complaint and then she used an excuse about pulling orders in the kitchen. <br><br>This was completely unprofessional and unacceptable. When a patron makes a civilized complaint it is completely inappropriate to respond to the complaint the way she did. I will never spend my money at this location again.
Oof. I didn&#39;t know there were bad The Cheesecake Factory locations until I came here. The restaurant is filthy and the service is slower than slow. Skip it.

Usually I love the Cheesecake Factory but don&#39;t go to the one in Baltimore harbor the service was the worst and the wait was very long.  Between waiting and being served we waited 1 1/2 hours for a table 1/2 hour till our waitress came for our drink order another 1/2 till we received drinks 45 minutes till she put bread on the table and took our order and another hour and a half till we were served.  The couple next to us was in and out before we got our meal was served and the manager in the last few moments before they finally served our meal finally came over to apologize and offered us free desert which we asked for to go and it showed up before our meal.  Oh and our steaks for dinner when they showed up with our steak knives took another 20 minutes to receive and our steAks were cold.

Came to the Cheesecake Factory on a Friday night and it was packed. We were quoted about 20 minutes for a table for 2 but decided to sit at a table at the bar because we could still get full food service and there was one available.<br><br>My three stars is more based on the restaurant vs our server. Our server was doing the best she could but it seemed like she had too much on her plate. It was probably almost an hour between sitting down to actually getting our food. We sat down, ordered drinks about 10 minutes later, ordered food, didn&#39;t get bread for another 15, and finally eventually our food.<br><br>The food we got was pretty good though. I got the chicken Marsala and BF got a shrimp pasta dish. My pasta probably could have fed a small army it was HUGE. I definitely had enough for dinner the next day. We also got some cheesecake to take home cause at that point we felt like we had been at the restaurant forever. I would still come back to Cheesecake Factory because I love their Cheesecake but this visit was just so-so.

Family and I decided to come to The Cheesecake Factory for dinner after the Science Center. We came on a Sunday around 5pm. There was a 15 min. wait which wasn&#39;t bad at all. Place is clean and staff is very friendly. My son has a peanut allergy and the waitress was very understanding and ensured us she would inform the cooks. Our appetizers and main course both came out in a very timely manner. My wife complained that her mash potatoes were warm at best, but overall the food was great. The cheesecakes of course are amazing!  We&#39;ll definitely be back again.
Walked in 85° inside temperature walked out how can u seat people to eat in August with sub par .... response was a rubber stamp bullshit reply

Terrible service on February 21st; food was cold and put a damper on a great day. I came to the restaurant to have a nice dinner with my wife. We were seated really quickly and the host was really nice and polite. Our waitress was unorganized and did not ask if we wanted water. She was polite but also very busy. We ordered the fried Mac and cheese balls for an appetizer and it was good but some of the inside was cold. We asked for bread and it came out warm but very hard. I ordered the Louisiana chicken pasta and it was good. I also added shrimp to the meal and the shrimp was not tossed in the pasta but otherwise was good. My wife ordered the DaVinci (sp) pasta that was in a wine sauce that was supposed to come with chicken and a steak, that was extra. The pasta came out without the steak addition and that was emphasized to the waitress. The rest of the pasta was ok but not up to standard so she ordered another dish to replace it. The chef came out to ask what was wrong and he was polite. Our waitress was very nonchalant about the dissatisfaction of the pasta but did change the meal. My wife then got the NY Strip 22oz with mashed potatoes and Mac and cheese. She hated it! The steak was decent but the mashed potatoes tasted sweet as if sugar was mixed in and the Mac and cheese was subpar. The manager came out and to our displeasure he chastised us about how the food was made and only offered to take the meal off. That was ok but his response to the service we had this night put a damper on a great day at Baltimore&#39;s Inner Harbor.

I ordered from DoorDash too hungry to go anywhere so I ordered a few favorites of mine and to my disappointment the strips were extremely spicy and crispy and my carne steak which is a New favorite. Was really burnt onions and peppers were burnt corn was burnt steak was burnt. But the kicker was that the rice was and is extremely hard and it is stuck to the back of my teeth. Not worth the amount of money. The only good thing was the salad that&#39;s why I gave 2 stars

This place took took almost 20 minutes to acknowledge my order over the phone today. I was told there was a long wait. When I walked in though after just 2 or 3 mins there was no one waiting and the waitresses were singing songs, giggling and having a good time amongst each other. <br>Previous time I came here with my colleagues there were flying roaches on and around our food. <br>All they do to fix these situations is offer a free cheesecake. Do not recommend this place to anyone. Find somewhere else to feed yourself. <br>Added snapshot of the call history for proof. Check it out in photos.

Long waiting time<br>They said that we need to wait for 30 minutes and we wait for one hour. It takes 10-20 minutes to order and another 30-40 minutes to serve the food.  It takes 2 hour just waiting here and there. Definitely not 30 minutes. They need to hire more staff and they have a lot of seats not occupied. It&#39;s just big waste of time!!!!!!

Came here on a cold Wednesday night right before Thanksgiving with my girlfriend. Everything was good up until the point where when I asked for the bread basket, the server then replies that they ran out, which was a total lie. There is no way that Cheesecake Factory ran out of bread. My friend works at a Cheesecake and they said that they throw it in to heat. We asked one of the bussers who was working hard cleaning tables close by us if he could get us some bread. He replied &#34;not a problem&#34; and he got it for us without any complaint. The busser&#39;s name is Lo, I applaud this man with this small gesture which made my experience here much better. Thank you!

I was in Baltimore for work and decided to hang around the harbor to grab dinner. While I was finishing up dinner, I decided to completely cheat my diet and visit Cheesecake Factory for dessert. When I walked in, I saw that it was really busy at the dessert counter but I figured, &#34;It&#39;s cheesecake, it&#39;ll probably move fast.&#34; I lie to you not, I waited in that line for 45 minutes for one slice of cheesecake. It was a Thursday night so I didn&#39;t expect for CF to be so packed but to be honest, it wasn&#39;t the wait that earned this low rating. The employees were rude, including the manager. I understand that sometimes you hate the people you work with but customers shouldn&#39;t be able to read that. I witnessed two employees getting into a verbal argument, I witnessed a flustered manager not knowing how to help his team, I witnessed unwashed hands touching food. It was just too much. <br><br>I would suggest coming early because I&#39;m sure you&#39;ll have a better experience.

The worst experience ever,took my family out to lunch which ended up being dinner because of the worst messed up service.After waiting 45 mins for a table cause the guy told us he wrote the wrong name.The waiter bought us the wrong drinks and food and,we had to wait like an hour for the correct food ordered.Guess what he got very little tip

The pasta was bland and way to gritty and had a weird peculiar taste to it. I&#39;ve had the same pasta at other cheesecake locations and they are never like that. It gave me food poisoning. The service was good though. Would probably not return to this location again.

I gave this Cheesecake Factory location another try. I figured, it&#39;s been a couple of years...perhaps it&#39;s improved. The experience:<br><br>I was dining alone, so the hostess figured that I should be wedged into a corner at a tiny half booth table, six inches from a young couple on a date. When other tables were available. Seriously?<br><br>The bread...stale! Seriously. Very hard. Disappointing but it&#39;s just the bread I suppose. <br><br>Entree: Cajun jambalaya pasta. They got it mostly right. No issues other than scrimping on the shrimp compared to when I&#39;ve ordered this at other locations. <br><br>The couple on their date unfortunately got only half their meal...after a long wait...some screw up with lack of pizza dough. This led to much apologizing...which I heard in detail, as I was practically sitting with them. To my shock, after serving the guy his dinner...but not the gal...the waiter asked her if she wanted something instead. WTF? It should be a given that she gets whatever she wants - comped! Maybe both should have been comped. Not my business but...are you kidding me? (A manager finally intervened and it appears they were compensated). <br><br>No check in by my own waiter for a drink refill, incidentally. Another minor ding. <br><br>Conclusion: Not much change from prior visit. This location seems to struggle. Maybe good help really is hard to find.

Terrible experience.   Waited over 10 minutes to check in and get a pager.  Totally disorganized system.  Lots of people frustrated.   After 20 minutes with a pager, I checked in again.  The girl at the desk ignored me.  When another guy came to the counter, she finally noticed me.  She said our pager wasn&#39;t even in the system!  Another 5 minutes to get seated.  Wait service was slow and bad.  Had to ask for silverware and napkins, drink. refills etc.  Waited 15 minutes for our check.  Food was good...until I found a hair in my dish when packing to take home.  Just awful!!!

This Cheesecake Factory is perhaps the worst in the United States. Service is unreasonably slow, we waited an hour to be seated (was only supposed to be 15 minutes). Our appetizer took another 35 mins to come out. We have been here for nearly two hours now and haven&#39;t even eaten. It&#39;s always like this. Can we please get some new management at the Baltimore Cheesecake Factory?

This location is showing its years of wear. We moved from our first table because it was dirty. In fact, the entire place could use a really good scrubbing. Crumbs on the floor, benches and tables. The staff in the kitchen were loud, yelling, laughing ... very unprofessional. Our server, Tony was new and did a fabulous job. The food was good as well.

Went for lunch on Saturday. Waited 1.5 hour for 2 salads and a flatbread. Completely unacceptable. Had to throw food in boxes once it arrived and run to meeting. No one offered appetizers or anything while we were waiting. Don&#39;t waste time or $$$
This was the worst experience I have ever had going to Cheesecake Factory.  If I could give this location a minus ten I would.  Service was horrible and the food matched the service.

Lemon-herb chicken: tasted like store bought rotisserie chicken from stop and shop...no lemon herb flavor at all.<br><br>The carrot sides was a regular carrot boiled and cut into big chunks. <br><br>The service- waitress gave us what we needed, nothing less nothing more...maybe because we didn&#39;t order drinks? Also I had to ask her to give me the free bread....didn&#39;t know I had to ask for free stuff.<br><br>At least the view was nice.....but the view is nice everywhere else!

Condescending and rude manager by the name of Christopher. After ordering a orange creamsicle that was full with so much ice that they cubes were faking out of the glass. I asked to speak to a manager in regards to seeing when I got another it wouldn&#39;t be filled with a that much ice as in my opinion it was not ok.  Christopher then proceeds to say it&#39;s just a spritzer it&#39;s not a drink drink. I stated that&#39;s fine but the amount of ice is too much because you only receive two sips of the tall glass with ice. Chris states well it&#39;s only meant to be Six ounces and the rest ice while smirking. Not a &#34; let me get you another&#34; no can I see if I can get you another with less ice? Just it is what it is so resolution just a yeah I can&#39;t help you. So I request a glass of water with six ounces to see if it fits and he does happily but brings 4 ounces which does fill the glass. So unprofessional and petty is my opinion. I rarely travel to Baltimore and this place CF is one I&#39;ll never visit again.

I usually love the. Cheesecake Factory.  Food is usually consistent, good service, and pleasurable.  Hat did not happen at the Inner Harbor location.  It was my first visit to this one and it will be my last.  <br><br>I took my family on a weekday, during lunch.  It was raining that day so I would say business was on the slower side.  We were seated right away, but the host wasn&#39;t very nice.<br><br>They had just cleared and attempted to clean and set  the table.  But there were visible streaks from wiping the table leaving it looking filthy.  The all but a few pieces of silverware had food stuck on them.  Our waiter was nice but absent.  He never brought back the silverware I had ask him to replace.  It took forever to place our order with another server.  We had to ask for bread from a third person.  And I had to ask silverware from another employee eventually.  The food took forever.  They forgot to put in my order.  The food itself was good.  Other than that, it was not a good dining experience.  <br><br>I will NOT come back to the Inner Harbor Cheesecake Factory location and would recommend anyone to steal clear.
We love cheesecake factory but HATED our experience last night. <br><br>This location was filthy, poor service, and the food was awful. Terrible

We&#39;ve been big fans of Cheesecake Factory but we were disappointed yesterday. It wasn&#39;t super busy but the restaurant was unkempt and service was very slow. Servers were unprofessional and unfriendly as they argued with one another and loudly complained about various things at the servers station beside our table. Food was just just okay...fries were barely warm. Burger was very good and of course cheesecake was great. But everything else just underwhelmed us. It&#39;ll be a long time till we go back there again as there are many other choices that we&#39;ll visit first.

This was the worst expirence I have ever had at any cheesecake factory. I ordered a raspberry lemonade and on first sip I knew something was wrong. The lemonade was rotten, it was fizzy with an off taste. That meant no one in that restaurant tasted it for quality. Then my mom ordered tater tots that came with sour cream. And...The sour cream was bad also. It was separated and lumpy. Both items were sent back and I asked tto speak to a manager.<br><br>When the manger came over he gave a half-hearted apology. This location should be shut down purhed of people who dont care and retrain the staff. If you are in this area and are hungry, do yourself a favor and avoid this restaurant like the plague.<br><br>ZERO STARS!

Went here on a Friday night to celebrate my nieces 13th birthday. The service was great the food was hot very delicious I&#39;m so mad I can&#39;t remember the waitress name she was amazing an the drinks were great (meaning a lot of alcohol) I only ordered one..

We had a fantastic experience.  Our server was amazing. She was friendly, knowledgeable and attentive.  She suggested the Pasta Napolentana and OMG... it was delicious. I am hopeful that Ann will be here on our next visit. She made this a memorable experience.  We let the manager, Anthony know our expectations were exceeded during the visit.

I did not dine there, but Manager, Beau wowed me on the phone.  I wanted to treat a dear friend and her date to dinner.  He is leaving for an overseas deployment in Japan soon, and I wanted to thank him for his service.  I called to see how I could accomplish th surprise, and Beau had two viable options, while making certain my credit card was not compromised.  We had success.  They were surprised and Beau made certain my friend knew she should check her E-mail  to find the gift certificate.<br><br>So kind service via the phone during their dinner rush on a Saturday evening warrants my praise!<br><br>Thanks again, Beau!  <br><br>PS- I apologize if I guessed the spelling of your name incorrectly.

Our experience at the Cheesecake Factory today was wonderful as always! My mom and I split the chicken quesadilla (so cheese-y and delicious) and got the Smore&#39;s and Original cheesecakes for dessert. We took advantage of Half-Price Slice Day! Service was a little slow, but otherwise good.

As we are waiting for our booth, our booth has something crusted on the side which smells absolutely awful!   Across from us, there must&#39;ve been a spill which they covered with napkins and has been laying there longer than it took for our food........which just arrived.  After three attempts to get my husband&#39;s burger not bloody, they failed.   <br>We&#39;ve been to many CF&#39;s from Pennsylvania to Florida.  Always a great experience.  This is definitely our worst by far

This location continues to be a disappointment. Slow and disengaged waitstaff serving room temperature food. If a 5 year old says &#34;mommy these fries aren&#39;t hot&#34;, then you KNOW something is wrong. I love Cheesecake Factory food so much, but am consistently annoyed when I leave. I keep coming back because of the carrot cake cheese cake..... can you blame me?!

My wife and I had late lunch here after visiting aquarium 3:30-4ish today. My wife had the mac and cheese burger medium doneness and fries with ranch dressing, I had the chicken carbonara. We also had the chicken potstickers app. The potstickers were good. My chicken carbonara was bland. My wife&#39;s burger was all bun, barely any mac and cheese and the burger was burnt and well done. The ranch dressing was hot, gross! The manager comped my wife&#39;s burger. After we paid, a shady character with a pink backpack and one of the cooks brushed by me in the men&#39;s room. The cook grabbed something from his sock to give to the shady guy. Seemed like a lower tier establishment than I was expecting.

We have been stopping by on our way to North Carolina for the past three years. There is nice parking right across the street. We prefer to sit outside and take in the views of the harbor. Staff are extremely friendly, and we have not had to wait for a table on any three of our visits. As we are traveling, we just order a variety of appetizers to share. Food has been great, and we always save room for cheesecake. Highly recommend Taquitos, Spinach Artichoke Dip, Hot Pretzels and the Reese&#39;s PBC Cheesecake

Me and my sons food was every good .... and my cheesecake was awesome ... my husband order was messed up he asked for no onions and it was like they add extra onions to his meal.... the service was okay .. and it took over a hour after we ordered for our food to arrive

Stopped here for dinner after a long day:<br><br>+  Not crowded.  We came on a Friday night.  We walked straight in and got a table right away.  In contrast, we had dinner at a neighboring restaurant the previous night and because of the convention, it was PACKED.  The wait time for a table there was 1 hour.  Also, at the Cheesecake factory at home (Waikiki, Hawaii), there&#39;s always a line and they don&#39;t take reservations.  This was a nice change.<br>+  Decent prices.  We&#39;re used to inflated tourist prices at home and were expecting something similar here, but were surprised that the bill was pretty modest.  In fact, we were so surprised with the total we thought there was a mistake and actually double checked the menu.<br>+  Service was pleasant and attentive.<br><br>We knew the entree sizes are typically HUGE, so we decided to share appetizers (goat cheese and beet salad, mini crab cakes, buffalo blasts, fried mac and cheese, korean cauliflower).  Food was ok.  The beet salad was probably the tastiest.  <br><br>All in all, a safe choice.  Not spectacular, but not horrible either.

This was mine and my family&#39;s first time at The Cheesecake Factory. It was the worst restaurant experience we&#39;ve ever had. It took 25 mins for our food to come to the table and 10 mins for my long island to be made. I ordered a steak dishes that came with half a plate of corn and half of plate of cold rice and 4 small steak cubes. Don&#39;t waste your money.

Called to find out how long the wait time was for 2 people. Was immediately placed on hold and left there for 50 minutes before I hung up. Yes, 50 minutes does seem like an unreasonable amount of time to stay on hold but we wanted to see how long it would take for someone to come back to the phone. After I hung up, I called back and was able to speak to a manager who was apologetic but gave me, what I believe, was lip service because something similar happened before with this same location.

I understand restaurants get busy on a Saturday night but to be left on hold for 20 minutes is utterly ridiculous. We called from 2 phones and got the same results. Someone answered and said Cheesecake Factory please hold. I hung up after 1 minute but my lady is still on hold as I type this at a whopping 23 minutes. I guess business is so good inside that those calling don&#39;t matter. I had to put 1 star but that&#39;s being generous

Happy hour! Large food portions, very inexpensive, and the drinks are great as well.  I hadn&#39;t been to the location in a couple years, but i throughly enjoyed myself this evening. My server , Yuliya was beyond phenomenal. I&#39;d come back tomorrow just to have her as a server. If only happy hour wasn&#39;t only 2 hours, that&#39;s a bummer lol

I love eating at Cheesecake Factories when I am in a location that has one. This was highly disappointing. First the beeper system did not work properly as multiple people were told they were paged and didn&#39;t come to be seated. All of us did not have our beepers go off. Secondly, took forever for service, never received bread, went almost the whole meal with no refill on drink and then when got the refill it tasted like burnt tea grounds. Pay attention to the ratings, it is accurate.
Veeeeeerryyyy slooooow service... we were waiting for a table 40 mins, then for our waiter for another 20 mins, then for our food 30 mins... still waiting for a check.......

Got a cale salad for lunch. It somehow took 25 mins for me to get the salad. It took so long that I&#39;d had to ask to get it to go. I&#39;m not sure how a salad can take that long. The salad tasted good though, hence the 3 stars. <br><br>Didn&#39;t try their cheesecakes as I don&#39;t want to get fat but I&#39;m sure they&#39;re great.

I love cheesecake factory and have visited many locations in several states over the years. Since I currently don&#39;t live in close proximity to one, I don&#39;t frequent as often as I like. I was happy to see this location was within walking distance to my hotel. We stopped in for late night appetizers and drinks. Although service was a little slow, we were happy with our food and the drinks were nice and strong. The key lime cheesecake I ordered was divine.

I ordered the orange chicken take-out and it was great! They made it so it stayed crunchy. Now I gave them 2 stars because their cheesecake had plastic...in the cheesecake...and it made the entire cake inedible because each forkful, I was worried there would be more plastic. Would&#39;ve given 1 but the orange chicken was good.

Ate lunch here today. Because there is a convention in town not sure how service is normally. Our server Chris was helpful friendly and pleasant. This restaurant is always a good choice. The food was good and of course the cheese cake was great.

The herb crusted salmon is not cooked! Very bad! Seems like it was frozen before going on grill. <br>The avocado egg rolls was very oily and didn&#39;t taste good at all. They offered a replacement but we declined.

Visited in Baltimore on a Saturday for Lunch. The restaurant was very loud and messy.. service was really slow. We ordered the avocado egg roll and it did not taste like the dish as we know it ..<br>Also the four cheese pasta was ok but a little bit salty.. <br>the restaurant has no wifi :/

Whew chile, where do I start...let me start of with the good I guess....at least the wasn&#39;t long we was told it was going to be a 40 min wait but we we&#39;re  seated in about 10 min but sadly that was the only good part...we ordered on drink appetizers and food all at the same time. 2 juices for the kids, a <br>Sprite and a smoothie, the drinks came out with the appetizer and the bread (no butter by the way) expect for the smoothie. Then we waited and waited and waited and still no damn food my patience was not going quickly then our waitress finally came back to tell us our food should be coming soon. Okay great I thought but little did I know my ass would still be fucking waiting another 25 mins by this time I already knew the food was going to come out cold...still no freaking smoothie by the way. It&#39;s like our waitress went on break are some shit. Then our food finally came I was sooo over it, and guess what it was cold only thing that was at least warm was the pizza for my son. Still no smoothie by the way, we asked the person we bring the food out for us she&#39;s said and quote sorry I have nothing to do with that ask your waitress...(but where the fuck is the damn waitress. Have way through our food she Emerge only to omg you didn&#39;t get the smoothie yet  listen if I could give this place no freaking stars I would. The absolute worst

Be prepared to wait. The food was great as to be expected by CCF my only gripe is that we were not able to split our bill, maybe it was just a bit of miscommunication on our party &amp; the waiter. Other than that no trip to CCF would be complete without purchasing a Cheesecake, I normally get either the Strawberry or Red Velvet. (This time i got both shh.) Either way it was a nice outing out with the family.
This place is always packed. Not a huge cheesecake fan so this probably diminishes my review a little. The pasta was decent but also was nothing special. Its okay for a visit once in awhile.
I enjoy the cheesecake factory and order often off of door dash. It never fails though they always forget something off my order. Smh

Average at best. Looks nice inside and the food is ok.  They have trimmed down the menu but its still a 22 page monstrosity.  They do have some decent lunch specials and a new healthy menu section.  The main reason to go here is cheesecake which is fantastic.

I ordered some food from here tonight using Postmates. Wish I would have checked the yelp ratings first. Food was way overpriced for what I got. Kinda tasty, but getting cold. The egg rolls were soggy. The chicken sliders were PATHETIC. The actual chicken was less than half the size of the little buns. Total ripoff. Plus, the two sauces they included with the sliders didn&#39;t have lids on them, so of course they spilled in transit and soaked one of the buns in a sauce I don&#39;t like. Big waste of money. If your food is going to be subpar, fine...then I expect more of it for that kind of money.  I don&#39;t recommend this place at all.

This place is amazing. The food was absolutely awesome. I got an order of Jamaican black pepper chicken and shrimp dish. Also got an order of Strawberry cheesecake. I couldn&#39;t give the 5th star because the lines are pretty long, the tables don&#39;t get fully cleaned off, but that&#39;s pretty much the only down side. Everything else is pretty great. The staff are very nice and attentive. The food is perfect. It&#39;s kinda pricey, but so worth it. Warning: the menu is pretty long but that&#39;s not a bad thing.

We showed up in a large party and despite calling ahead and being told it was okay, they were not prepared. Upon discovering that our silverware was dirty and requesting cleaner silverware, instead we were brought a glass of hot water by Dwayne and told to clean ourselves. Only after complaining loudly about writing a negative yelp review did he give us new silverware, that was also dirty. We waited a very long time for  our meals and checks, and when I went to a friends table to pay his check was greeted with a very rude waitress named Miya who was angry that we did not put the checks in order for her and made a very rude comments such as &#34;I guess I have to figure it out&#34; very aggressively. It then took another 20 minutes to get our checks back. And mediocre food at best.
Gd Evening I had Dinner at The Cheesecake Factory. I had the Shrimp Scampi . It was Delicious. For Dessert I had the White Chocolate Raspberry Cheesecake  It et

Food was pretty good not outstanding but just pretty good. Server guy was a little strange but friendly. Atmosphere was very nice. Walls and floors and all around very creative art and decorative. Sat right across front the bar and tall tables with seat at the long long table. My Wife&#39;s family and I and a family friend. We all had fun and enjoyed eating out together at this location. After we ate we shopped around the mall. Which was cool.

Terrible. I&#39;ve been seated for about 45 minutes. Our food was served maybe fifteen ago. We still don&#39;t have napkins. They served me half my meal. I&#39;ve finished it and I&#39;m still waiting on my mashed potatoes. They&#39;ve gotten my drink incorrect twice. Ordered grilled asparagus and we got fried. The hosts/hostesses were extremely unpleasant. <br><br>Overall they are liars, incompotent, and we still don&#39;t have napkins.<br><br>EDIT: We were just told &#34;I don&#39;t know if the kitchen is going to make any more mashed potatoes.&#34;  If I ran my life like this restaurant ran it&#39;s business then I&#39;d be dead by now.<br><br>SECOND EDIT: They offered desert and we still don&#39;t have napkins. To her credit, our server was very pleasant.<br><br>THIRD EDIT: We all ordered slices of cheesecake to go and when I got to my hotel I saw that mine came in pieces, like a child&#39;s hobby model kit. This place preys on dopey tourists, because it is obvious that they don&#39;t get repeat business.

Terrible customer service. I asked for a lunch portion for dinner and the server brought it to me but then the waiter and server wanted me to pay the dinner price. The  manager was young, dumb and rude and demanded I pay for something I didn&#39;t get. I got up and replayed the scenario<br>And he acted like he was doing me a favour. All this over $4 for a party of 9. Dumb move on July 1st on your patio and my friends will not be back. He gave me the discount after I had to defend myself so much. Good riddens...there are lots of restaurants that are way better!!!

Worst experience I&#39;ve ever had at the Baltimore site. I&#39;ve been to other sites and had great service. Waited 45 mins to get a turkey burger with a green salad. They must have been hunting the turkey. When I finally go the burger it was pathetic. It sat under the heat lamp for too long rendering the patty rubbery and the green salad side had wilted as a result.
Smelly restaurant. I&#39;ve never experienced that before! Bartender was not very responsive even though we were at the bar in front of her. Good was lukewarm not hot.
