Really really horrible customer service and very unpleasant experience. I was told there isn&#39;t any table available even though the place is half empty. This is at 10pm. I was told to sit at the lounge high table but no one bothered to offer me a menu or asked if I wanted a drink. Had to talk to someone looked like a manager. This is UNACCEPTABLE.

My family and I here on vacation. We were hungry and wanted to eat at a familiar restaurant. Thus, we decided to eat at The Cheesecake Factory. We waited for an hour even though there were many open tables. While waiting we heard/saw about three plates being broken. There was food all over the floor.  The wait staff walked over food and dirty napkins on the floor like they were not there. Over all, it appeared that the people who worked there were not serious about providing good service and keeping a clean restaurant.

Good service, great chicken parmigiana sandwich and chicken Marsala! Love the bread and butter and was able to add sautéed spinach. The lemon cheesecake was amazing! We were very happy with our meals.

HORRIBLE SERVICE. Do not go here if you are on a time schedule. Waitress was completely unapologetic when food came out in 20 min increments and was ALL cold. All food was over an hour wait. Manager was no help--as server/bartender I am usually very forgiving but the service we received tonight was unacceptable. Would not recommend to anyone!

Monday July 31 was the last day for half price Cheesecake Factory.... National Cheese Cake was celebrated two days at The Cheesecake factory this year with half price on all cheesecake flavors. Hubby and I tried the birthday cake flavor and the snicker flavor, yep the snicker flavor is our favorite cheesecake ...The line was out the door when we left, we got there 11:30 am no line and they let you buy as many as you want and they even gave out a coupon for free cheesecake on another visit if you spend $30 that day  ...... The NEw Birthday cake was so good better and fluffier better than I expected and they cut the NEW birthday cake flavor slices extra big, I guess for promotional purposes.

We have been to this location multiple times with no issues.  But we haven&#39;t been there in several years.   Last night everything that could go wrong did.  We arrived at around 7:30 pm- my husband and our children.  My youngest is 17 months and needs a high chair.  The hostess leaves us there with no high chair and it takes us 30 minutes to get one.  We order our food, the waiter got my husband&#39;s order wrong so we waited another 30 minutes for his correct order.  He ordered the herb roasted chicken which is supposed to be half bone in chicken- he orders it all the time if we go there.  Below is what he was served- burnt chicken covered with some herbs to cover it up.   When we got a manager she did not care, did not say anything and took the chicken off the check and walked away.  Our waiter looked horrified.  However we expected a lot more at a well known chain and plan to call corporate on Monday.

The service of this place is terrible at best. Walk right to the bar asked for an order togo, the female bartender said I need to go by togo counter. While she isn&#39;t busy at all. Went to Togo counter waited for over 15 minutes while no one is ahead of me, and can&#39;t take my order.<br>Came back to the bartender made an complaint, then she finally took my order.<br>The service on both are piss poor at best.
Super good location <br>You can&#39;t beat the menu <br>The outdoor patio is right over the harbor <br>Nice Sunday brunch selections<br>Fills up fast

We are here trying to have dinner at the bar but the employees are too busy talking to each other. They are literally yelling back and forth behind us and in front completely ignoring my husband and me along with another couple.

We always look forward to eating here!  This time we weren&#39;t 100% satisfied! Although we were seated quickly, it took our server a long time to stop by! I asked for water without lemon, so they gave me a side dish! When I entertained the thought of using one, I noticed a small piece of hair on it! My turkey burger was delicious, although it was messy! I had to eat it with a knife and fork.  The lettuce in my salad seemed wilted! They sat us in the back by the door that the workers constantly went in and out of multiple times! It locked afterwards, so at times they would bang on the window. We must have been close to the work area because they were very loud and some of the conversations were unprofessional.

Host and waitress standing around on cell phone flirting with a non customer gentleman People standing around no help at the bar not urgency to customers  service is slow and no management in sight. No water or bread offered.Facility in desperate need of a facelift... very unacceptable appearance and service .<br><br>Food came out bottom plate full of some sort of sort of sauce that doesn&#39;t come with my meal...<br>Overall waitress was kind and pleasant but no support from other staff or management and restaurant wasn&#39;t even busy.

Really disappointed with the food. I was in town visiting family and decided to stop by here for lunch... can&#39;t go wrong with a meal at The Cheesecake Factory right? Wrong! The food was terrible. Ordered the fried shrimp platter. The French fries were greasy and salty and so was the fried shrimp. The amount of salt on the fries was unacceptable. I also ordered Pineapple Moscow Mule which was basically a fruit juice. No alcohol and a cup full of ice. My cousin ordered the fish and chips and unmediated returned it for the same reasons I stated above. I was so disappointed I&#39;ve haven&#39;t been to the Cheesecake Factory in a few short years but was not expecting for this type of decline in their food.<br>I will say that the service was really good. Molly was in training and she was awesome!!! <br>Manager came over but he was worthless. I actually caught him rolling his eyes as he took away the plate we were returning.
Don&#39;t show up at 10:46 to get cheesecake to go on a day they advertise to close at 11:00.  They wave at you at behind locked doors and laugh that you can&#39;t get in
Terrible and slow service. Dirty table and dirty plates. No napkins. Do not come to this restaurant. Plenty of other great choices nearby.

This was the absolute worst dining experience ever.  20 mins for the server to take our drink order, 20 mins to get drink.  Drinks came and the server spilled them all over my guest.  Horrible service, the manager did not even try to make it right.  We had to clean up the mess the waitress made.  No help from cheesecake staff, manager never offered to change our table etc.. the manager didn&#39;t even comp the tea the waitress spilled.  We had to ask to have it removed.  The kicker the restaurant had no one in it.  Absolutely horrible, don&#39;t waste your time.

This is a public safety message. Horrible. Rancid. Inedible food. Everything but their dessert was horrible. I don&#39;t know how they passed the health inspection and can serve food. Our entire party of three people didn&#39;t have one edible dish. We&#39;ve been to other Cheesecake Factory restaurants and were satisfied. Don&#39;t waste your time or money at this location. Our server, was however, very nice.

I&#39;ve been to this Cheesecake Factory 6-8 times over the years and I&#39;ve always had a good experience. This time was not a good experience. We waited at least 15 minutes for our server to show up to take our drink order before we got fed up and left after no one ever came. This used to be the only reason to come to the Inner Harbour lately but I&#39;ll just avoid it all from now on.

What started out as a terrible experience got better. A poor greeting was corrected by a great Harbour view table and a very bad G&amp;T was re-poured with fresh tonic. Lettuce wraps were quite good and rushed service was not bad. Overall, the Harbour made it perfect!

Extremely slow service!!!!  Once seated it took the waiter 10 minutes to come take our order. One order was wrong and it was never brought out. Everyone in our party finished eating and he still didn&#39;t get his plate. Spent 2 hours from start to finish and still got things wrong.

This was THE WORST CHEESECAKE FACTORY. First of all when we went the Hostess was super rude. Told us wait was 45 mins, so after 45 mins my fiancé went back and ask her how much longer she told him 10 mins. 15 minutes past by I go back and ask and then tells me it&#39;s going to be another 30 minutes. I tell him and he goes back to talk to her and they sit us immediately but with huge attitude.  Then ended up waiting 15 more mins until the server comes over and introduced herself.  We order our food and she tells me that Thai chicken wraps were out earlier but she will double check with the kitchen and let me know. After another 30 mins and only getting one refill of drinks everyone&#39;s food comes out except for mine. The server never came back and let me know so I assume my food order was placed. My friend goes up to the server and ask about my food because at that point I&#39;m already too upset. The server tells my friend to pick something else off the menu.  So we ask to talk to the manager. The manager didn&#39;t care about our situation and just brushed us off. Terrible customer services. We arrive at the restaurant at 8:30pm didn&#39;t leave until 11:15. Waste of time and I left still hungry. Never again. Do not go here.

Very long wait for our party to be seated. Our server seemed frazzled and overwhelmed. Food was OK, far too many spicy options. No prices on drink menu is irritating. I don&#39;t think we&#39;ll come back next year.

This is the most dirtiest nastiest cheesecake factory me and my wife have ever been to in our whole lives and it&#39;s in a tourist area so say they get 5 negative stars be sure to bring a bottle of hand sanitizer with you for your entire evening !!!
Awful Service maybe the worst ever, however the food was very good. If you have lots of extra time and a lot of patience stop in. Otherwise, AVOID!

BAD. THE WORST. SMELLY. GROSS. UNPROFESSIONAL. JUST WTF.<br><br>I don&#39;t even know where to start with this one. Just...don&#39;t go here you guys. Go to the one in Towson or Columbia...just so much no. <br><br>*EDIT: I can&#39;t really say to much about the restaurant as a whole...this review it mostly for the bar area only*<br><br>Let me just say how bad it smelled in here ok? It smelled BAD. Whoever mopped the floor the previous night must have used old water or something because the whole front room smelled like clothes left in the washer for 2 days. <br><br>I wanted to give them benefit of the doubt and blame it on the harbor but as I walked around different parts of the restaurant it was obvious the smell was coming from the counters and floors. <br><br>Arrived at 5:15 on a Friday and it wasn&#39;t quite busy. People we were just starting to show up for the Happy Hour rush. Took a seat at the bar and ordered a couple of drinks. I&#39;m guessing the bartender who was serving us was about to clock out or something because she kept rushing us through our orders and then giving us a check. (I&#39;m assuming she wanted us to pay and tip before she left but we literally had just got there....) After she printed the 3rd check we had to tell her - &#34;Hey were gunna be here a while and probably order some more stuff so can you just keep the tab open???&#34; I mean really that should have been obvious from the start.<br><br>But the real upset came when the next bartender showed up for her shift. She blew into the bar making a whole bunch of noise and then proceeded to CHANGE HER CLOTHES RIGHT AT THE BAR. <br><br>Shirt off. Bra out. Tummy out. JUST EVERYTHING OUT. WTF?? You guys don&#39;t have an employee lounge or locker room? A BATHROOM????<br><br>Like she really just changed her clothes in front of all us just sitting at the bar. AND THEN she decided she was just going to get to work taking orders and making drinks. Didn&#39;t wash her hands or anything.<br><br>I get it. If your running late for work you want to jump right in and act like your working and do the damn thing. BUT AT LEAST WASH YOUR HANDS!!!!! She was sweaty and winded and it just overall wasn&#39;t a good look...<br><br>Now hey- I know what you guys are thinking. She was probably having a rough one and I should cut her some slack. But even still- this was my first experience at this location and I&#39;m sorry but it was a bad one and I have the right to express that!<br><br>Half way through my time at the bar the manager had to come out with a toilet plunger and unclog some drain at the bar that was messed up. <br><br>***Imaging sitting down at the bar trying to enjoy your meal when some guy comes right in front of you with a freaking plunger and starts thrusting it up and down right in front of your face*** No excuse me. No I apologize but... just WHAM. Out of nowhere he just pops in with a huge plunger and starts hacking away at a clogged drain.....wtf guys...what the....f*ck.<br><br>One of the bartender girls was like, &#34;Haha did you get that from the bathroom?!&#34; He smirked and didn&#39;t answer... I REPEAT HE DID NOT ANSWER. <br><br>Everyone sitting at the bar just stared at the guy. Like....are you going to confirm to all of us t patrons that YES INDEED THAT TOILET PLUNGER WAS NOT ACTUALLY USED ON A FREAKING TOILET BEFORE YOU BROUGHT IT OUT HERE AND STARTED USING IT ON STUFF RIGHT NEXT TO OUR FOOD AND DRINKS????<br><br>Guys....just not. All the no. <br><br>0/10 would come again.

Been to this location a couple of times, mainly to order a slice of cheesecake to go.  The lady that works the togo register is always so nice, plasent and joy to work with.  I wish I knew her name so I could give her a shout out!  I have seen her have a long line, moving customers along with such poise and never loosing her cool.  She has never gotten an order wrong for me and is still personable even when she is busy.  <br><br>I have also been seated a couple of times here, nothing to spectacular about the service.  Since it is a chain, I know I will get the same meal each time I return.  I do enjoy their food as well as the ocassional treat of their cheesecake here and there.
Dwayne was a really cool waiter. He recommended his top choices for my friend who&#39;s first time it was at cheesecake. My friend enjoyed his food most

This was my first time being at the Cheesecake Factory. I have always heard good things. I really liked that they have a skinny menu! I ordered the pear and bleu cheese flatbread and was quite satisfied! The drink prices seemed a little expensive, but then again I&#39;m from Montana (we have cheap booze). After dinner we took a slice of red velvet cheesecake to go. It was DELICIOUS! Definitely couldn&#39;t eat more than a few bites but it was very good. <br><br>Also our server, gene I think? Was really nice and accommodating. We squeezed 7 people into a booth and he was very patient with us!
Great and amazing customer service. The food was carefully prepared! Our guest was so impressed. We were served by Chelsea, who is an asset to the restaurant. Thanks!

You can never go wrong with the Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s consistent across the U.S. I know because I&#39;ve worked there for over 4 years and I have eaten at many different locations. We checked in around 5:45pm for a patio table on July 4th. We requested a table by the water, so we can watch the firework at 9:30pm. We knew it would be a longer than usual wait but we timed it correctly, so we can enjoy dessert and fireworks at the same time. Our server was really sweet. She didn&#39;t rush us at all. I&#39;m sure she knows everyone on the patio are just sitting there waiting for the fireworks. <br><br>My favorites are the frozen iced mango smoothie, avocado egg roll, shrimp scampi and white chocolate raspberry cheesecake. You won&#39;t be disappointed.
It took our server 15 minutes to bring us water. It took 30 minutes for us to order our food. The whole dining experience took an hour and fifteen minutes. We only ate salads. No thanks, CF.

Nice and fancy place love it. Could be pricing or just fair for this area. Good costumer service, nice and clean. <br><br>My cheesecake delicious and cappuccino was fine. <br>I didn&#39;t like (at the To Go side) the way the labels are posted for the cheesecake selection, make confusion at the time to choose which label belong to each cheesecake.

I&#39;ve gotten food poisoning from this place multiple times!! I never learn-- if you&#39;re set on cheesecake factory leave the city. If you&#39;re more flexible choose a different resturant close by-- there are plenty of options if you dont mind the walk down the harbor towards fells point and several others in many many MANY other directions. Please dont repeat my mistakes.... I can tell you now you&#39;ll deeply regret it.

I came here with a party of 18+ with about a $700 tab about a month ago and I must say, that was hands down the most disrespectful and unprofessional service I have ever received in my life. I&#39;m more pissed at myself I didn&#39;t ask for a manager or get the waiters name though. Hot tip. If you&#39;re going to be rude and degrading to a party that big, make sure one of the people you are waiting on wasn&#39;t a previous NYC waitress in Manhattan who knows about ticket times, auto gratuity and the whole process in depth. Make sure you aren&#39;t rude to the biggest tipper at the table and a now restaurant owner who knows how shitty a server you were and how unacceptable you were being. First off I&#39;m going to say what in the actual Fuck. A party that big should never have 1 waiter to begin with. A minimum 2 would be ideal. How do you expect one server to properly serve and wait a table that big in a timely fashion while dealing with other tables in there section? That was completely unacceptable from the start. Do you not have table runners or something? With a venue that popular at the very least the table runner should have been helping bring food out. Is it because auto gratuity is already added on a table that big so you don&#39;t care how the service goes from that point onward. Secondly the server. If that was my establishment he would have been fired after that day. The entire table orders water, except me and my two kids with me. We like to enjoy ourselves when we go out. The waiter said and I quote, &#34; Great a whole party of waters, go figure.&#34; Excuse you? Being in management and a previous waitress what the actual fuck. Doesn&#39;t try to say it under his breath or as he&#39;s walking away says that bluntly to the entire table. The people who&#39;s tips contribute to your paycheck. Okay. Next on the agenda, we were seated at two separate tables outside not pushed together. Okay. At my establishment that&#39;s two separate parties not one. We were added to one giant bill But okay. After taking the whole tables drink orders half of the drinks come out the remaining half is missing. Then he starts taking orders.  Half of the the tables order then goes in to ring the meals in before coming to take the other half&#39;s order who has yet to have drinks. I&#39;m sure you see the problem here already so I&#39;ll carry on. So finally my drinks come out. But wait just the two sodas not my sons apple juice. I waited about 12 minutes for my drink. So I tell the server, &#34;my son still doesn&#39;t have his apple juice.&#34; His reply? &#34;Oh don&#39;t worry it&#39;s coming&#34; well after 12 minutes it clearly wasn&#39;t so my pissed off self sets a timer, because the waiter was very clearly reminded. Our second table in our &#34;party&#34; is time to order. The one in which I&#39;m in. I told him to skip me because I was undecided. His fucking reply? &#34; well you better know what you want by the time Ive taken everyone else&#39;s order because I already put the other tables order in.&#34; FUCKING EXCUSE YOU. At this point I&#39;m livid and it&#39;s taking everything I got not to march up to the hostess desk. So everyone else at my table orders except one other person. Who he says the exact same thing too. Except at that point I&#39;m done being the clueless bitch he thinks I am and I say you know he has a milk allergy right, and a nut allergy, and an egg allergy, along with about 12 other things so it&#39;s going to take him a minute unless you can name something on this menu that doesn&#39;t have any of those in the mean time my timer on my phone says 18 minutes and my son still doesn&#39;t have his apple juice that I shouldn&#39;t worry about is coming. I think at that point he got the memo I was sick of his shitty attitude. 12+18. My son waited 30 minutes for a drink. He got his drink as the first tables food was coming out. I was pissed. My food came out wrong and while I was waiting for my added chicken for my pasta to cook probably because he was so busy rushing us he forgot to write down the order right the first table was asking for dessert and to go boxes. I could go on and on and on but that&#39;s just the icing on the cake. If you go here, expect to be treated rudely and if you have a food allergy, you might as well just stay away because they clearly don&#39;t have the time, training or education to know how life threatening they can be.

Quite a mixed set of feelings about this Cheesecake Factory. I do like this chain. They are very consistent and clearly - they know their niche - the cheesecakes. <br><br>This location is in the Inner Harbor mall. A prime location with tourists and locals making it a very busy hot spot. There is quite a bit of seating outside when the weather is nice. And if going here during usual peak hours or weekends - expect a wait - as is the case at most other locations. Here&#39;s why the place gets 3 stars in a nutshell. <br><br>- Decor / design: The place is over crowded with more tables than it ideally should have. Especially the outdoor seating, was simply put - chaotic. We got a table for 6 outside and although the view of the harbor was pretty, our table was right next to 2 other tables and it was quite a mall cafeteria kind of experience. Then there was this whole umbrella issue. The attendants outside could not have the tables covered with enough umbrellas given it was s scorcher of a day. Again - very chaotic. <br><br>At one point, we considered moving indoors. But after taking a quick look inside, it wasn&#39;t a great idea to switch tables. It was a massive wait for a table inside. So we stuck to what we got. <br><br>Food: I don&#39;t think I have ever had a reason to dislike their food. If there is one thing I can describe the food as - it would be consistently the same across the board. No matter which location you go to, you know you are at Cheesecake Factory. Given the hot summer day - I got a salad. Sheila chicken with avocados. Very light and fresh through and through. Others next to me got fish and chips and Bang Bang chicken and shrimp. Everyone was happy with their meals including myself.<br><br>Service: This was a very mixed experience. First the positive. Our waitress was very kind and always around to check on us. Our meals arrived on time. We were quite happy. Now The negative. The staff outside wasn&#39;t very accommodating with the arrangements. Primarily the umbrella situation that I mentioned above. This is probably a point that should be noted by the management of this branch. They should either reduce the table count outside or figure out a way to make the patrons comfortable outside when it is hot and humid outside. <br><br>For food alone, I would rate this location 4 stars. For the overall experience - the 3 stars.

When we walked into the place we noticed a terrible smell. Almost like they mopped the floor with an old dirty bucket of mop water. It has been a few years since we came to this location and I have to say it is long overdue for a facelift. The whole place seems to have a layer of grease and age on it. After we were sat we waited a good 10 minutes before our server greeted us. And by greeted us I mean grunted at us. Literally, he plunked down four waters and grunted at us then he just stared us for a few seconds then says, &#34;Hi. I&#39;ll be your server. Do you know what you want?&#34; It was pretty cold, unwelcoming and unprofessional.  The food took 40 minutes to get to us. When it arrived he couldn&#39;t remember what table it went to and delivered it initially to the wrong table. We asked for no salt on the fries and it arrived smothered in salt. Everything was dripping in grease. I realize this place is busy because it is the Cheesecake Factory and it is in a great location but I&#39;m hoping reviews like this will prompt some change. Tourists don&#39;t deserve to spend so much money on such horrible service, food and atmosphere.

2 waitresses argued with my girlfriend and I that this was a medium burger. Manager apologized and took it off the bill but, at the end of the day, this is how people get sick. I wasn&#39;t born yesterday. The fact that someone had the audacity to even argue this blows my mind. There are way better options in the inner harbor.

The food is good. Crew were so loud in dropping plates. when we were seated one of the crew told us the seat was reserved and brought us in the new table in not in a manner way didn&#39;t even say sorry. (Shorthairgirl) <br>The place is so noisy..
This place is trash. The service sucks. The waitress are so dam rude. They give you a mean face when you ask for high chairs.

Ordered takeout and got the Cobb salad with chicken off the power-menu.  Nice mix of veggies, seeds, beats, quinoa and beans. Just get a different dressing, the one that comes with it is doesn&#39;t really go

So many problems. Bathroom smelled horrible. Kitchen was so loud next to our table throwing dishes around that we could barely have a conversation. Utensils were on the dirty (and wet) table instead of a napkin and we saw servers/manager touching them with their hands. Water had things floating in it. Bread was cold. Taquitos had no flavor. But the entrees were good and server was nice.

Ordered a carrot cake and a reese&#39;s peanut butter cheesecake through DoorDash. Was informed by DoorDash that the peanut butter was out of stock. I told them they could substitute a signature strawberry cheesecake. When the cheesecake arrived, I noticed it was covered in mold

Unfortunately this cheesecake is slightly below par compared to other locations. I think it&#39;s because of the fact that the locations is constantly busy and because the people who work there don&#39;t really do a great job keeping dishes consistent. I&#39;ve been to this location several times. It&#39;s mostly filled with tourist and people who are here for the baseball games. But there&#39;s always just a little bit of a malfunction whenever I come here. <br><br>Like I said for a Cheesecake Factory at least you always know the food is decent. The cheesecake is always phenomenal. The &#34;skinny&#34; menu is very convenient for the weight watchers conscious customer. And there&#39;s enough variety to keep you coming back to try something new. Wish they had valet parking.

The location is amazing. On the water, prime downtown Baltimore real-estate. Has a lot of potential.<br><br>I&#39;ll be a pessimist and list the CONs first:<br>- The bathroom was dirty. <br><br>-The host was seating someone for probably 4 minutes when we got there and so many employees walked by us, none of them acknowledging us with eye contact or a &#39;someone will be right here.&#39; It was kind of frustrating.  <br>When she returned she said &#34;Two?&#34; (as in &#34;Do you need a table for two?&#34;) I said &#34;Outside, please&#34; and she said, &#34;We don&#39;t do outside service. Only to-go.&#34;  I was kind of confused. I  guess it was because it was nighttime. But why would I order a nice, fairly pricey dinner to-go then un-package it 20 feet away?  I&#39;d rather sit down and enjoy my meal with service. and be able to have a drink.  So we opted to sit down...<br><br>-Our table was REALLY close to our neighbors table (maybe 1.5 feet away) and we were trying to have a nice quiet dinner out. <br><br>-The drinks are strong and tasty but REALLY expensive - $11 and $12, which once you add 20% tip equals $27 for two drinks. Ouch!<br><br>-This may be a PRO to some but was a CON to me - the menu is beyond huge. It&#39;s an entire book. My boyfriend and I spent a very, very long time debating what we wanted to order. Chicken A VS. Chicken Pretty Similar to Chicken A, appetizer w/ seared tuna and avocado VS appetizer w/ seared tuna and soy sauce with dipping sauce... you get the idea.   This was overwhelming and I would prefer less options.<br><br>PROs:<br>-Amazing waterfront location. Found metered street parking fairly easily.<br><br>-The Cheesecake is AMAZING!  We went simple and got the blueberry. So heavenly and presented well.<br><br>-Food arrived quickly. I recommend getting your app then ordering your entree so they dont come out too close because the servers do not pace properly.<br><br>-Jamaican Chicken and Shrimp was so excellent! My boyfriend and I shared it -the portions were huge.<br><br>-Strong drinks.<br><br>Service was decent, no problems and I was indifferent to our waitress. This place gets pricey if you add on drinks to your meal though.  I can imagine sitting on the waterfront has to be really nice!

I don&#39;t know 1 person who haven&#39;t had a meal here. This location of course is the 1st one in The Maryland area which is awesome for the harbor. I&#39;m not a fan of chain restaurants normally but I will say that this is a little better than some. Since parking is horrible in the harbor i prefer to go to the Columbia location. Today I went to Happy hour and I never ever had a problem with customer service here is always top notch to be a chain but today I&#39;m guessing it was a manager or supervisor screaming to the bartender that just came on duty &#34;you are over pouring&#34; and of course he didn&#39;t hear him the 1st time and he comes and says it 2 times while me and other guests are sitting there which to me is so unprofessional he could have pulled him to the side. On top of the shift change along with the rush of guest coming in. Now do I want to hear the bartender is over posting drinks that wasn&#39;t mine? Nope! So yup I&#39;m upset. Now to the nice happy hour menu everything was $5.95 you can&#39;t beat that! Now to the selection of cake, cheesecake and so on. I&#39;m in love with everything here. My favorite is the red velvet and lemon meringue cheesecake. Meals: I love the shrimp scampi, 4 cheese pasta and the meatloaf. The serving sizes are always huge!! You most definitely get your money worth here which is not going to be much.
Pear and Blue cheese flatbread. What is this? Your cook needs to be fired. Missing 2 toppings and has like 3 walnuts on top. To-go order FAILED AGAIN.

So disappointed!!! I ordered a veggie burger and they came out with a turkey burger so I sent it back. Everyone else received their food and was eating while I&#39;m still waiting for my veggie burger. ...

The food here was decent, I got the Chicken and Shrimp Jumbalaya and the portions were huge! As for taste, it was average. But that is just me, since I like my pasta with more thick sauce. Service was a little slow at first but then the waiter was very attentive with refilling drinks.

Service is good and the location is clean. Waiters/waitresses are friendly and attentive when time is alloted for them. Food came out at a normal pace.<br><br>I was just slightly dissatisfied with the size of my crispy crab bites and that the sauce lacked flavor and tasted like mostly mayonnaise but I could be wrong and realized that it is offered on the skinny menu.<br><br>Maybe it&#39;s me or my taste buds but it seems at this location I need extra salt for every plate. I&#39;ll still patronize this one though. Good quality and huge servings. Beautiful view of the inner harbor at downtown Baltimore.

The family and I came here after our trip to the Aquarium for lunch. It was a rainy day and it wasnt very busy so we were sat right away. Overall good with a few complaints.<br><br>The Good: Food was excellent. We had the fried Mac and Cheese for an appetizer and my wife raved about it. She had the chicken fettucine which was really good. My son had the spaghetti with meatballs that he picked at but was good. I went with the usual there, the meatloaf. Again, food was excellent! <br><br>The Bad: Im not sure who designed the bathrooms but they make no sense and make it really awkward. Ill post a pic <br><br>The Ugly: There was a fly in my wifes drink. I saw it right away thankfully, and the waitress saw me pointing it out. She said &#34;Is there something in there??? I thought I saw something!&#34; REALLY? She actually said that. How about checking 1st before serving the extra unwanted protein.

Where do I begin....<br>The host tells us it will be a 15 to 20 minute wait (no biggie) I take the broken buzzer and proceed to the hallway because there is no waiting area space. My group is seated and I join them only to walk up to a table for 4 with and extra chair at the end which was of course sitting out in the sun unlike the rest of my table. I clearly requested seating for 5 and I assumed we would be seated at a table that we would at least accommodate 5 adults.<br><br>I know what you&#39;re thinking; &#34;was it crowded in the patio area&#34;? No, it was not. <br>As I looked around to first see if there was a larger table to accommodate my party of 5, I noticed there were only tables of 4 (some empty some with patrons). The table next to use sitting in the shade (that my friends chair was pinned against) seemed to be the most logical choice to merge with our table (because they couldn&#39;t seat anyone else there while we were at our table) I asked our waitress; I think her name was Jasmine if we could merge the tables together and she said no because we could be too close to a party of two&#39;s table that was on the other side of the table we wanted to merge and bring closer in our direction. <br>For the life of me we couldn&#39;t understand how she was going to fit 5 cups of water, 4 cocktails, 2 appetizers and our 5 entrees at this baby table. The answer is...SHE COULDN&#39;T!!!! We did let her try though. <br><br>She told us we couldn&#39;t combine any tables but we could go back inside and ask if they could seat us on the inside.<br>Now one would think if you&#39;re given an option to sit inside or outside and you choose outside, that&#39;s where you would prefer to sit, but I could be wrong.<br><br>We were shocked considering we&#39;re from MN and our Cheesecake Factory on a bad day, with all the cheesecake and liquor being sold out, would still out shine this place. <br><br>Our waitress checked on us 3 times. Once to take our orders, once to bring a cocktail she forgot, that we had to stop and remind her to bring, and when we asked for our bill. (Our food was delivered by other people).<br><br>Would I return to this location? Nope, nadda, never in lie!

Initially we went here off plan. The wait was 20 minutes and was very busy. We were seated in 20-25minutes and got a booth! I&#39;m addicted to the complimentary bread and butter! For appetizer my friend got wings and for course my friend had a burger and I ordered the jambalaya shrimp pasta (something different). I tried the pasta and it was horrible and dry! There was more seasoning on the side of the plate as decoration then the actual pasta. The waiter took the pasta back in hopes of it to come back with taste but it came back with oil and dry seasoning. It was so bad the manager even apologized and said that it wasn&#39;t cooked right, they gave me the option of trading the dish for something else so I choose to pack the crab wontons and the apple caramel cheesecake. They turned out great! The waiter Gene, was amazing! Very attentive and compassionate with great customer service!
It is big and when we went no wait time for lunch during weekday. It is located in Inner harbor Baltimore.

Placed a phone order it was rang up in correctly waited 20 mins for my steak to be remade with the wrong sides still here waiting for the asparagus if your ordering ahead just go to capital grille they are much faster the lady at the register kept calling me &#34;baby&#34; im at least 15 years older than you it&#39;s disrespectful. Will not be ordering or coming to this location again<br><br>- changing review manager Paul reached out to me and resolved the issues quickly thanks for caring about your customers

I would highly recommend this place to anyone!<br><br> My girlfriend and I went to celebrate our one year. When we got there it was extremely busy and the wait time for a table was 1 hour and 20 min. They also have the option of first come first serve for the high top tables available. My girl and I waited patiently for one of these first come first serve tables for 20 minutes when a waiter hooked us up with a table because we had been so patient. The waiter we had, Dontay, just started waiting tables and it was only his 3rd night. He was extremely kind and very personable. We placed our orders and waited about 15 minutes for our food. When they brought out the wrong dish for me, they were very apologetic and did everything they could to make it up to us. When the food did come out it was absolutely amazing, their sauces are insanely good.I would like to thank Chanel for her help as well and especially for the free cheesecake!! These two definitely aided me in making the night special for my girlfriend and for the occasion. I am extremely grateful and would highly recommend eating here! <br><br>Thanks again, <br>Brandon

Although the service was good with our waitress<br>The food was TERRIBLE.. They need to get it together because the prices are too high to be having the cooks cook nasty food. I usually go to Annapolis but since I was out the harbor I said I&#39;ll go here. But never again. I&#39;m glad I didn&#39;t get carry out. I would of been so mad when I would&#39;ve gotten home. I had gotten the Chicken and Shrimp Gumbo.

I will say we received some of the best service here while in Baltimore. I walked in to grab a buzzer and the hostesses were so nice. They said it would be about 25 minutes. After standing outside for about 15 a manager came over to assure us we would be sat soon. He quickly sat us a few minutes later outside which gave us a greet view of the inner harbor. Our server was super nice and very attentive to our needs. He made sure the kids for their drinks and food quickly. My husband and I each got a small salad and the grilled medallions (skinny menu). The grilled medallions with veggies was delicious. So full of flavor and just enough for us. The staff made this experience!
The restaurant had quick service and an amazing waiter, I was able to make in back to my hotel in time. My waiters name was Berry and he made my short lunch enjoyable!

Dropped in for dinner last night and was UNDERWHELMED.  This chain is normally awesome, both food and service.  However, this location isn&#39;t.  They ran out of flatbread pizza?? I went with sliders and fries - yuck.

After a 20 min wait.....we were seated inside next to the inner harbor.    We ordered the mini crab cake appetizer which was good.    At our tables we ordered the quesadilla which was ok.   The bacon grilled cheese sandwich which was good.   An order of carrots which were glazed with pecans and they were yummy.    I had the Pit beef franchise dip sandwich with sweet potato fries add some Dijon mustard and it was very good.   We ordered too much food.   I wish we shared the meals.      <br><br>The wAitress was vey pleasant and helpful.   She gave us some cups of ice water for the afternoon walk on around the harbor.    <br><br>We needed to come back for slices of cheesecake to tAke home.   Thankfully we have a cooler in the car.   I plan on having a bite of the sinful cake each night this week.    <br><br>Yes, try the cheesecake!  (About 10/slice.).

Ohh Cheesecake Factory! Lol okay, where do I even begin. I went here to dinner for the first time with a girlfriend of mine. We are both CF fans but, have never been to this location. We arrived around 9 and had almost an hour wait. While waiting we saw very interesting things. Those things were. BALTIMORE CITY RATS! These were large RATS eating in the corner of the restaurant where you wait. We screamed loudly because we had never seen that before in an eating establishment. Yes, I know and am sure mice are around but, really? In the actually restaurant area smh lol. <br><br>Anyway, once seated we began to order the tex mex egg rolls but, were told that they were all out so we said okay no biggy. We will order our entrees then. The waiter then informed up that they are out of all meats expect salmon. So if we ordered pasta it would come meatless. I wasn&#39;t really upset but, wanted to know would it cost less than since there was no meat? My question was never answered. The restaurant was very busy and filled with high school kids who were very loud. The restaurant was also understaffed bc after our waiter took our order when never saw her again. Not even to bring the check lol. <br><br>We waited a very long time for our meal. Once we finished up we wanted our fav dessert. Come to find out ohh of course the apple crisp was all out! Sigh Welp that ended dinner. We left right before close bc we were waiting for so long. <br><br>Note: I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone ! Poor service, dirty location and bad food.

I&#39;ll be honest. The cheesecakes were excellent, 5/5, but the customer service was unprofessional and irritating. They brought the wrong order, gave us the check before we even started our dessert (we never asked for it), were asking to order before we looked at the menu, we had a hard time finding the host to be seated, etc. Don&#39;t get me wrong, the people working there might be very nice and great, there are just these small unprofessional things that leave an unpleasant aftertaste. Cheesecakes were really good though :)

Do not come here. We sat a group of 6 for early lunch. The restaurant was very empty. We still waited over an hour for our food. Once we got it, some was cold, others were given a different tables food completely. The staff were having loud arguments on the floor. There was a server doing selfies in the bathroom mirror. There were no check books when it was time to pay. This place is a zoo

I stopped in for something sweet after a concert at pier 6 and this place was packed! No one greeted me so I went over to the bar and grabbed a stool. The bar was small but no wait so I didn&#39;t mind. The bar tender asked if I was eating or drinking, that was kinda strange. <br><br>I order a brownie sundae and it was insanely sweet and was served with a cold brownie (warm would have been better) additionally and ice cream to brownie ratio was way way off! The presentation was pretty. Over it was so-so, the service was ok but I felt like I was annoying the waiter by only get a sundae but that&#39;s all I wanted!

Just went for desert.  Strawberry shortcake and Oreo cookies cheesecake which were both good.  Location is seriously understaffed.  Couldn&#39;t get water because no clean glasses and out of to go cups.  Empty tables outside but 40-50 min waits and the 50 minuets if you want dinner.  Empty tables outside but no one to wait on them.  Convention in town for over a week and service staff was short.

Being a foreigner this is my very first time at the Cheesecake Factory. I was not expecting anything from this restaurant since it&#39;s a big chain. Well I got surprised in a very good way! The interior of the restaurant looks really nice, I like a lot the vibe. The food was amazing to me, I got the lasagna verde and it tasted like a dish from a fancy Italian restaurant. Plus the portions were huge, my boyfriend got the eggplant parmigiana which was even bigger an delicious as well. Finally we shared the hazelnut chocolate crunch Nutella cheesecake and it was AMAZING (I don&#39;t even like cheesecake) overall this restaurant was a great surprise and will go to this chain again very soon!

Sooo the Cheesecake Factory was on one today....if being color struck wasn&#39;t enough, my Pineapple Mojito was nasty. They made another. That was nastier. Got the breakfast burrito and was cautioned about the hot plate, but never mind the cold food tho‍. My sis ordered shrimp and chicken alfredo....they boiled everything in the same pot, put it in a bowl, sprinkled parsley on it and voila!!! I&#39;m still hungry.....thanks for brunch CCF. Nunca no mas!!!

The Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite restaurants. I usually enjoy my visit with them however this location fell very short. <br>Upon arrival, we did have a short wait which actually was shorter than anticipated- but no big deal, as this is a place I don&#39;t mind waiting on.<br>However, when getting seated the table was dirty and the booth- all of which looked like it received a quick wipe down. Our server came for our drink order and since we were deciding on beverages she offered to bring us all waters but returned empty handed due to having &#34;no clean glassware&#34; at the time. After deciding on our bar orders she brought our drinks (mine was mai tai- very good) and the waters she promised earlier. 3 of the four waters had something floating in the glass. Disgusting. <br>I think overall the waiter checked in with our table 3 times, and didn&#39;t deliver anything but the drinks and the check- the appetizers and dinner was brought out by another worker. <br>I wasn&#39;t impressed with the food, nor the service or overall cleanliness of the location. I will not be returning and my $200 for the four of us was not justified this visit. Not to mention the waiter couldn&#39;t even split the check properly.........

This is the most ratchet Cheesecake Factory ever. Terrible service, brought me the wrong food, took too long, yelling match in the kitchen, and staff taking mirror selfies in the bathroom. It was at times hilarious,a if I wasn&#39;t starving. Only one snap.

Quite possible my worst restaurant experience. I am a huge fan of this chain and have been to many different locations. Their extensive menu always draws me back to try more. <br><br>However, on this particular night I went with a group of friends and was met with terrible service. We were seated promptly. However, our waiter had a terrible attitude as soon as we arrived. We waited 45 min for bread after ordering even though we requested it multiple times (very politely). She told us that it was cooking as they ran out and she would bring it as soon as it came. Some time later, she brought us COLD bread - a small piece for 6 people. <br><br>Then, when our food was finally brought to us - an hour after ordering, it was all cold. Everything. <br><br>Our waitress seemed to have disappeared for 30 min at a time. I have never wanted to not tip someone before, but left a 20% tip anyways. <br><br>Very disappointed in the Cheesecake Factory. Not sure if I will return.
This is a great place and had a open sitting looking the inner harbor..especially with OTAKON Convention that weekend.<br>You get full after just one meal but still order dessert to go. haha

This was our first time at any Cheesecake Factory. It was a busy Friday night. We only waited about 10 minutes. Our server was nice and friendly. The food was amazing. The price was reasonable. We ate at many different restaurants while in Baltimore this week. This was the best meal and the best price. I got the Thai coconut-lime chicken. WOW! The flavors of this meal were amazing. Got the salted caramel cheesecake and banana cheesecake to go. The salted caramel was very good. Banana had no flavor. Great place!

The Most Amazing Experience Ever Eating Here At This Cheesecake Factory And Here&#39;s The Reason For The Awesome Evening Out, First Of All Eye Had Been Waiting For Years To Dine At A Cheesecake Factory And JANEE You Left Me Speechless At The Amount Of Knowledge Of EACH Dish Which There Are Numeral Pages To Gleam Over, Janee Knew Each And Being A Vegetarian She Recommended Dishes And Went Beyond To Have The Chef Jazz Up And Make The Dish More Veggie Colorful A Statement She Used During The Ordering. Not Only Was The Meal De-lish And Healthy It Also Taught Me A New dish To Be Prepare At A Later Time. Janee Knew Ever Cheesecake On Site And All Eye Did Was Give A Mention Of What Eye Had A Taste For And She Put It All Together And The Most Wonderful Taste Ever Hit My Palate. You Were Super Friendly And Thats Often Difficult In A Urban City Not For Janee Thank You For An Amazing Wonderful Experience You Rock !!! The Resturante Sits On The Inner Harbour Water Front So All Is Good Can&#39;t Go With That Resturante Is Clean .

This was probably one of the worst Cheesecake Factory locations I&#39;ve been too. The service was great, but the food wasn&#39;t. I ordered my usual pasta and it didn&#39;t taste the same as it usually does. I&#39;m not sure if it is the fact that they are a touristy location, but the food doesn&#39;t taste like Cheesecake Factory&#39;s food normally taste.
Food was good! The place is way understaffed. Takes forever to get drinks, food etc..
Our server germon was super nice and friendly! Went out of his way to suggest bars and places to go while we&#39;re in the city. Food was fantastic as always!

I only came to grab a slice of cheesecake and run. After waiting on line for 20 minutes, I left. Apparently, they were having issues with the computer at the register and couldn&#39;t process transactions. I understand that technical difficulties happen but why wasn&#39;t another solution offered? I&#39;m sure that&#39;s not the only register in the entire restaurant.

Only in the US of A does a chain called &#34;Cheesecake Factory&#34; attain such success. This one in particular was bustling non-stop from the second we walked in till we signed the check. If you&#39;re in the mood to stuff your face with tons of food, you&#39;ve found your lunch spot. Falafel salad was good enough -- falafels themselves were actually delicious, but the salad was lacking in cucumbers, tomatoes, etc. -- and the avocado egg rolls could&#39;ve used a bit more flavor. Overall happy with the food though. Service was a tad slow as they only had one hardworking waiter covering too many tables.

Greetings, I was at your restaurant August 7, 2017 for my Birthday. The Food was Delicious and Exquisite. My Brunch was a Bacon, Jack, Spinach and Bell Peppers Omelette, Potatoes &amp; Toasts!  Great hospitality from the staff, our Gracious waitress was Jarae, she exemplifies what a waitress suppose to be... She was Kind, Knowledgeable &amp; Polite. I had a Great Afternoon!!!  I most definitely will recommend my Family &amp; Friends to have Lunch or Dinner there... and I will be back very soon!!!!

Another disappointing visit at the cheesecake. Went to the bar this time to see if it was better service... no. The bartender Malik was unprofessional talking to other servers saying how he feels as if he works at wendys...  well he acted like it. Bar was dirty my whole time there. I was the only customer but given zero service. I got my food Togo out of frustration and waited 30mins for my food I reminded him I was even there after 15 mins...

Today was the first time in some years that I&#39;ve been to the CF and I must say the wait time and our waitress was very friendly but our food calamari was under cooked raw batter on the inside and when we brought it to the managers attention he acted as if we did something wrong...I must say I will definitely wait another 6+ year&#39;s to even think about returning as of right now I couldn&#39;t even finish my beverage and I fell like I have to throw up....the worst part about it is it&#39;s a Friday night and not that busy....

I went during lunch on a sunny day and the place was packed, but service was still great. I recommend getting something light to eat for your main meal if you are planning on getting cheesecake for dessert (and why wouldn&#39;t you?).<br>The food tasted great! I ordered a margherita flatbread which was perfect because it was not too heavy. I had the Godiva cheesecake which was rich, creamy, and delicious.

Service was awful. They had one server for the bar area. Not his fault..it was the fault of the three managers that stood around doing absolutely nothing. Waited 15mins to be seen, 15mins to receive our drinks and 20+ to receive our meal. Not one to really complain but out of all of the Cheesecake Factory restaurants I&#39;ve been to, this is by far the worst.

I would have given it 5 stars if it wasn&#39;t for the service. Our server kept forgetting our orders because he didn&#39;t write our orders down. He kept asking us for the correct order while taking our order then kept coming back to our table to ask for it again. That&#39;s why you should write it down.<br><br>My friend and I ordered 2 cocktails and 2 appetizers, a crab dip and pork belly sliders. The food was delicious, which is why I gave 4 stars despite the slow service.
Delicious gluten free Shepard&#39;s Pie for lunch! Nice atmosphere. Fast service. Pricey but it&#39;s payday! Caramel CC to go!

Only giving this place 2 stars because the waiter was good other then that do not come the bathrooms are dirty the floors are unsweep all of our food was either burnt or overcooked after waiting a hour to receive any food turn around and do not waste your time.

I sat at the bar Rachel the bartender greeted me right away gave me a menu told me about happy hr. She let me know her shift was ending then introduced me to Marco who would be taking care of me he made my cosmopolitan perfect. I asked him what food he liked on the Happy hour Menu, he suggested the Tex Mex Rolls and it was delicious. I will definitely be returning to this location. But anyway Great Customer service at the bar anyway not sure about at a table.

My worst experience at the cheese cake factory. We have been waiting for 70 minutes for an outside seat while there are plenty of empty seats outside, and the front desk explained that it is the problem of the remote controller(some many functioning remote controller, why mine doesn&#39;t work?). The front desk even said to the manager that I was impatient to wait for the seat. I mean look outside , there are more than six empty desks without reservations, and some random guys just sat there and rest, and no one was stopping them? Please don&#39;t blame the customer for your system failure. After seated, I ordered a filet steak and a shrimp pasta, both of which didn&#39;t show up for an hour and a half. The manager explained that someone took the order and need to made me a new one. He was literally whispering all the time and I couldn&#39;t hear him. What kind of apology was that? If you are trying to find an execuse, don&#39;t use &#34;someone took your order&#34;. Who can take your order? Another customer? You kidding me? The waitress took the order to the wrong table. Just admit it. Why you lying? Or just say we didn&#39;t make you the food. So frustrating. I was a lover of cheese cake factory before, now I&#39;m a hater.

Greetings, I was at your restaurant July 8, 2018. The Food was Delicious and Exquisite. My Dinner was Cajun Jambalaya and My Dessert was Red Velvet CheeseCake!!!  Great hospitality from the staff, I had a Great Evening!!!  I most definitely will recommend my Family &amp; Friends to have Lunch or Dinner there... and I will be back very soon!!!!

This was the 4th Cheesecake Factory location I&#39;ve dined at and it was a pretty satisfying experience even compared to the others.<br><br>Being right in the heart of Baltimore&#39;s Inner Harbor, it was fairly busy. Luckily we decided to go when the weather was nice and the sky was clear. We were seated in less than 5 minutes and sat inside but by the open windows so there was a nice breeze coming in.<br><br>The food was what you&#39;d expect from The Cheesecake Factory franchise. This time around I got the Bang Bang Chicken amd Shrimp entree. Wasn&#39;t that big of a fan of it though. The sauce with the rice was flavorful but the chicken and shrimp itself were pretty bland and a little tough. I also had a Pina Colada which I enjoued even though I don&#39;t like alcohol all that much. My friends ordered Filet Mignon, Buffalo Wings, and the Lemon Garlic Shrimp from the Skinnylicious menu. We also ordered the Pot Stickers appetizer which was REALLY flavorful.<br><br>On the downside, our waitress was a little forgetful and we didn&#39;t get great service. We had to remind her to bring out the bread for us after we were seated.<br><br>Overall we all had a pretty good experience. Personally I feel that the weather greatly influences how great, or horrible, your experience can be at this location. Luckily we caught it on a good day.

Dont know where to start on how upset and angry I am. Let me start by saying I brought my husband out for fathers day. we took the long drive to Baltimore to enjoy scenery and have dinner. We checked in at cheesecake factory with the host around 7:18ish. They said it was a 40 min wait my husband and I where okay we saw it was busy we didn&#39;t mind the wait. My husband found a little table by the bar to wait it out. We order some drinks and a small sampler. We where just relaxing and waiting for time go by. Then I notice wait it&#39;s been more then 40 min. I went to check with the host. I asked her how much longer is the wait while I&#39;m holding the pager. She looking, I then notice the look of her face change like oh man someone has been missed. She looking looking and ask for a name and I give her my husband name and she was like oh we marked you as seated!! I asked for manger Brittany. She came over and asked what the problem was I told her we where missed. She acted like it wasnt a big deal. Excuse me it&#39;s not a big deal for a customer to be upset for being missed my husband has not ate anything all day and you just brush it off. We weren&#39;t seated until 8:57. We requested to be seated in front of the water and BRITTANY said oh we sorry we don&#39;t have any available, we have these seats left. The seat she gave us where in the corner away from the water. might as well seat us in front of the street. No type of privacy. We waiting for our waiter 10 min passed someone noticed we where not by being helped. Our waiter shows up takes our drink and food order. When he brought our drinks no bread was given. 5 min passed he comes back and was like oh do you guys want some bread??? My husband and I just looked at him and said yes?! Now the meals where even worst. I ordered the classic chicken alfredo and my husband order 4 cheese pasta. The alfredo pasta had no flavor, no season, no nothing plain and bland. Alfredo sauce running like water. I have NEVER experienced bad service and food at ANY cheesecake factory. My experience here was the worst. Hospitality sucked, service was horrible. I took a long drive out here to give my husband a surprised dinner, just to be disappointed. We never comeing back here. You know what they said its better to stick to places you know.

Went for dinner due to location in proximity to hotel -  I give it a solid 4-4.5 stars for maintaining the quality of the franchise.  Food was good/ service was good and over all atmosphere was busy but not overwhelming.<br>You will wait FO a table during peek times but that is true of any decent restaurant in the area. I would NOT recommend M &amp;S next door.

I am appalled by the situation going on here. <br>I love Cheesecake Factory, and I travel for work; so whenever there is a location in the city that I&#39;m in, I go enjoy one of my fave menus. This Baltimore location is an embarrassment to the chain. I went to eat with my friend. After waiting over 20 minutes for guacamole as as appetizer, it then took 40 minutes for our food to arrive, the table side service was few and far between (only refilling my water one time, etc.) we ended up having to have our food boxed because of time. I was very disappointed, but have the benefit of the doubt. <br><br>My mistake. <br><br>4 days later I ordered guacamole for pick-up 15 min before leaving work. I figured it was an easy enough request. When I got there to pay and retrieve, I had a To-go box of what what very clearly just mushed up avocado. I respectfully asked that it be sent back to have GUACAMOLE ingredients added. Trying to maintain patience as I stood waiting, my view of the kitchen shocked and startled me. NO GLOVES...people directly preparing and boxing food with bare hands. Employees eating food that they were boxing up for paying customers. Mind you, this is in plain view of all guests. I will never return to this location and made my concerns known. The manager was decent, and refunded me for the guac...but honestly seemed like he had no idea what he was doing. I am so sad to have to write a review like this :(

This was my first time coming here, so I didn&#39;t know what to expect. We got a beeper and an estimated wait of 20 mins which turned out to be 10, so it wasnt too bad. The ambience is very low lit and formal. Perfect for a dinner date. (There&#39;s no dress code BTW) and there&#39;s a good mix of booth and table seating.<br><br>My utensils were dirty, but they were quickly replaced, so no problems there. We didn&#39;t get any bread, but I didn&#39;t want any so that was fine too.<br><br>Our server was nice. We ordered chicken potstickers as an appetizer. They were half boiled, and pan fried on one side so the texture was weird, but they tasted okay Nothing too amazing. I got a raspberry lemonade (really sour) but the sugar on the rim of the glass helped out. And my boyfriend got a simple sprite since the only tea they had was unsweetened.<br><br>The menu is about a thick book long and its filled with sidebar ads which distracted my from ordering. I ended up getting the chicken bellagio which sounded better than it tasted. The chicken breading was soggy, the arugala was bitter, the prosciutto was slimy and the pasta was a little on the aldente side. In fact the best part about my meal was the side order of Mac and cheese - An Ooey Gooey Overdose of Cheesie heaven served in a small cast iron dish.<br><br>My boyfriend ordered the bacon bacon cheeseburger that had thick cut slabs of bacon (putting down my weak prosciutto) and he recommends it. I had a bite. It was delicious!<br><br>The waitress took forever to come back with the doggie bags and check. And when she did, i ordered the salted caramel cheesecake to go The meal was around $78 (gratuity tip not included) Overall, the experience was pretty good. I guess simple is better when it comes to a place like this.

I was in Baltimore by the inner harbor so i decided to have dinner at my favorite restaurant. I ordered the filet mignon medium but instead got a hard cooked crispy steak on the outside and medium well on the inside. The veggies were tasteless and bland. Not much effort was put into their most expensive dish. What a shame. I guess not all Cheesecake Factory locations are the same.

I been coming here for years.  We always stop by after Os game.  They have great drinks.  I always get the shrimp bistro.  And then finish with a to go Adams cheese cake.  Always busy but I haven&#39;t had a bad meal.

We just left this location and it definitely was not a bad experience. The staff were all very nice and checked in on us appropriately etc. The food was very good. Nothing wrong with anything except the bread which is free so... whatever lol. The bread was on the harder side but I still ate and enjoyed it. My only critique i suppose is that I thought the place&#39;s silverware and tables could&#39;ve been kept cleaner. Otherwise it seems this place is trying hard to make their customers satisfied and happy customers. So I&#39;m okay with this place.

Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite restaurants.....HOWEVER; this particular location was terrible. They ran out of stuffed mushrooms, over cooked the steak and left chicken off of one plate. The manager Chris was very standoffish. He spoke like a pre recorded message was insensitive to us not being satisfied. THAN my tequila shot had dirt like a lot at the bottom. Just a bad experience all together.

I always bust this restaurant, actually my favorite. Tonight was different. Daniel was my server, and it seemed like we were not a priority. Late drinks(after everyone around us got theirs) and he asked everyone how the service was but us. Just don&#39;t know. Excellent place, just be mindful of your waiter

Terrible atmosphere, unless you like to listen to the employees having passive aggressive arguments whilst slamming dishes around. The rudeness between them definitely makes the dining experience awkward. It also results in the slow service s well. Worst Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been to in 4 states.

The cheesecake doesn&#39;t disappoint, but the food is more often than not hit or miss, which isn&#39;t made any more tolerable by the absurd wait times. Still, the menu has choices for everyone and I have a few go to dishes that tend to be reliably good. Maybe if there weren&#39;t so many options there would be more consistent food quality across the board.

Meh. My boyfriend and I went to the harbor tonight to celebrate our 3 year anniversary and ended up at cheesecake. Note: the two stars are for the waitress who was very nice and the fact that the outdoor table we requested was ready in 40 minutes even though the original eta was one hour. <br><br>We were seated around 8pm. When it came time to order our meal, the waitress promptly informed is they were out of bacon and French fries. Being vegetarian we could give a shit about the bacon but the bf had actually been in the mood for French fries. Eventually we realized we never received the complementary bread which arrives hot and fresh almost instantly at the Columbia location. I encourage you to take a guess as to why. Yea...you guessed it; they were out of bread too. Seriously guys?! You&#39;re running out of menu staples on a Saturday in the summer before the sun has even set? Most peculiar of all was later in the meal when the waitress said something along the lines of &#34;blah blah blah we have French fries now&#34;. Huh? How&#39;d that happen? <br><br>For dinner we ordered artichoke spinach dip, avocado spring rolls and vegan Cobb salad. The dip was watered down to the point where I wonder if they were running out of that too so decided to add water and flour which would also explain the lack of flavor. Cobb salad left something to be decided by my boyfriend enjoyed it alright. <br><br>Overall feeling:

Worst service and the manager was the most unethical and unprofessional lady I have ever Met. They made us wait for more than an hour and still were least interested to let us know what could be the additional wait time.

3.5 stars<br><br>We came here on a Sunday after visiting the National Aquarium since it was a short walk over and we were in dire need of a drink. I&#39;ve never seen a Cheesecake Factory so crowded before! Luckily we landed seats front and center of the bar, I was not going to wait that long. <br><br>Our bartender was very attentive and friendly, always refilling our water and asking if wee needed anything more. We had originally come for drinks but, they didn&#39;t offer happy hour on weekends and a Long Island was $10. We just stuck to an appetizer, the avocado rolls. The rolls were too heavy on the avocado and just too small, would have been better with some more bell peppers or an added texture. The sauce put a sweet twist on the otherwise bland rolls (docked half a star). They were not worth the $11 we paid though (docked a star).<br><br>All in all, our bartender was wonderful and the appetizer was ok. I would only come here to order half priced drinks and apps during a happy hour or split a large entree for lunch or dinner if I was in dire need of good food. The view is nice, its right on the harbor.

WORST restaurant experience ever. We (2 adults and little kids) came in on Saturday at around 11am for early lunch. The place was not busy at all. We were seated outside right away and the waitress told us she only had 2 tables, including ours. And then.....30 min wait to get the kids water, 40 min wait for the high chair and NO food in sight. We sat for an hour and a half with no appetizer and no meals. The kids were of course losing it by that point. Finally the manager came over and asked what was going on. I explained and he said the food would be right out. Then our waitress magically appeared with three of the four plates. Everything was dripping in oil And looked awful since it had clearly been sitting in the back for a while. She then placed my one year old&#39;s meal on the edge of the table and of course it fell and the food spilled. My meal never came. Anyway, we just got up and left. The manager (Alex) at least comped the meal but still...UN freakin Believable. Officially crossing Cheesecake Factory off any future dining lists.

DO NOT EAT HERE!!! Took them an hour to get our food. The manager did not help or apologize for the wait all he did was come to the table and was like umm let me see what&#39;s going on and never came back because he was to busy talking and hanging out with his employees outside. It was also my sisters bday and they never came out to sing happy birthday so the entire service and food was just horrible.

We were a party of 2. The lady at the help desk picked up the phone and I think she was talking to her BF. Stood at the desk for more than  5mins and no one even looked at me including her and the room manager who picked up another line. Guys you don&#39;t take reservations so why is it that you were on your phones. Keep in mind we were the only ones in line and it wasn&#39;t packed at all.<br><br>My colleague found out about the bar tables which didn&#39;t really require reservations. After sitting down for 15mins, no one had even bothered bringing us the menus. There was a lady sitting with her kids and husband across from us who had ask led us of what is going on as no one showed up at their table.<br>After calling out the room manager, we had received the menus.<br>Our waiter looked a bit high and he wasn&#39;t that focused at first but then he got warmed up.<br><br>Here is the most important thing:<br>Ordered their famous lemonade with my main course and  I felt something wrong in my stomach but didn&#39;t really understand what that mean until I went back to my room.<br>I got food poisened to a point that I am still suffering till today.<br><br>I wouldn&#39;t recommend such place at all. Unfriendly staff, cleanliness, rude help desk and unprofessional people. Wondering if the cheesecake head office are aware of such a place being ran by kids. Plus bad quality food which led to food poisoning.<br>Reason behind unprofessionalism is that we witnessed on a scene that happened behind us where a waitress began screaming and telling her story to other coworkers about a man who didn&#39;t leave her a tip. Everyone sitting on their tables and bars began looking at her and she didn&#39;t really care.<br><br>Advice to management: if you can&#39;t find the right people who can give their best, simply close your location as it it ruining your good reputation.

First, I will say that my waitress(J)  was wonderful and I would give her 5 stars. I give the rating I do because of the quality of food and flexibility to accommodate customers with special dietary needs. First, they did not devein the shrimp on my shrimp sandwich ($13.95)---that&#39;s a pet peeve of mine and quite frankly, it&#39;s disgusting. Also, I got a side salad instead of fries and it was just lettuce...no veggies! <br><br>Secondly, my partner is a vegetarian and wanted to get the Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp minus the meat and substitute in veggies(broccoli, spinach, and avocado). The waitress checked in with either the chef or manager(not sure who) and told us they could make it, but that it would be an extra dollar for avocado. The dish was already $18.95 for chicken and shrimp and they&#39;re telling us that it will be $19.95 to have veggies instead of meat!!! What?!?!?! That doesn&#39;t even make sense; we were both livid. It was definitely not worth the money. <br><br>The sangria was weak and at $11.00 a glass; I expected better. <br><br>The avocado spring rolls came with a tamarind cashew dipping sauce; both were delicious and a definite highlight of the experience. <br><br>Thankfully, the waitress and service was on point. <br><br>I&#39;ve gone to Cheesecake Factories in different states and this was by far the worst. <br><br>Find another place if you&#39;re in the harbor and want a good meal. I won&#39;t be back.

Raquel!! Raquel!! Raquel!!!<br><br>Thank you for making my 1st trip to baltimore a memorable one. I was having such a horrible morning today but sitting at the bar and talking with you lifted my spirits and as a fellow bartender and hospitality enthusiast, I salute you!!! Great cosmos, Great Convo and Great Empathy!! You Go Girl!!! <br><br>P.S. I downloaded yelp on my phone and created an account just so I could write this

I&#39;ve been here twice and the location is great! view of the inner harbor and on a sunny day, you can even sit outside to eat.<br><br>but the food has it&#39;s ups and downs. the cheesecake obviously is pretty good.<br>-pasta da vinci - pretty good! a unique sweet and savory sauce with penne and chicken, but about halfway through, the sweetness is too overpowering and makes you get sick of it<br>-louisiana chicken pasta - this was pretty good. chicken was well made and the pasta was flavorful<br>- calamari (the breading wasn&#39;t good), porkbuns, burger were all just average...meh<br><br>some of the other pastas my friends got looked good though, i hope to try that if i ever go again.. but i probably would want to go to little italy if i wanted good pasta. <br><br>so yeah, i recommend trying the pastas if you come here and ask for an outside seat if it&#39;s good weather!

This location right in the middle of Inner Harbor often has a long wait line. The menu here is quite large and it consists of your standard American fare. Like every other cheesecake factory, the portions here are large and will easily fill you up. The food itself is okay, but the service here can be hit or miss. I have ordered pasta and burgers here, which are decent, but sometimes the service can take a long time to take our order or refill the water. <br><br>If there is no wait, then I&#39;d consider this place, but if there&#39;s a line, I&#39;m going upstairs to UNO&#39;s for some Chicago style pizza.

I came here once a week for the past month because of various friends in town, and I&#39;ve gotten their farfalle (my favorite dish there) but it defiintely has not been as good as I remember.  The first time, there was tons of sauce but not enough farfalle.  The next time, we ordered extra farfalle, but they poured so much salt into the dish, it was SO salty I just tasted salt, nothing else.<br><br>I also got the Carlton salad which I thought given its ingredients could have been a lot better, but it didn&#39;t taste very good.

Like any other Cheesecake Factory, but this is at Inner Harbor, Baltimore. Food was very good, and our server was exceptionally nice. It was a very lovely lunch while we spent our rainy day in Inner Harbor. Close proximity to all the activities this place offers.

if i could leave this place no stars, i would. i went on saturday 8/17/19 with my fellow military friends and they treated us like garbage. the &#34;manager&#34; &#34;brittany johnson&#34; told us that she wish that we would leave after we asked for some compensation after we waited 3 hours for our meal. after waiting that long, the server told us that the thai wraps were no longer available and asked what else we would like. at that point we did not want anything but a refund. &#34;brittany johnson&#34; called the cops on us and forced us to pay. we paid and she called the cops on us again, while we were paying. she lied about who the general manager was and im sure she lied about her name. i do not recommend this restaurant at all.

Service is really bad.... <br>Wait for a long time but without even a napkin or folks.... Finally, all dishes come , however , no waiter at all. When waiter showed on, just ask&#34; do you need box? &#34; &#34; Do you need order extra things?&#34; when we just work it less than 30mins... Then, gave us bill and stood nearby waiting for writing tips.... WTF?! Never will come back again......

I had a pleasant experience at this Cheesecake Factory location. I ordered the Black Pepper Shrimp dish that came with shrimp, black beans, rice, plantains and mango. And booooooyyyy was it delicious! My date looked at my plate saying it looked good. Deep down inside I snickered a bit because my plate definitely looked better than his pasta dish. Either way we were both very satisfied. Our waitress was very friendly. We sat at the bar area since it was such a long wait for the seated area. We also ordered the egg and avocado rolls for an appetizer. Those were just okay. Felt like they were missing something and also tasted store bought. For dessert we got the red velvet cheesecake. Delish! I just wish that the presentation of the waiters and waitresses were improved on. I worked in retail before. It doesn&#39;t hurt to reflect a better standard.

Came here on a Saturday night and this restaurant for take out cheesecake was jam packed. I waited on line with girl cousin for half an hour to order a slice of Cheesecake Factory cheesecake. I ordered the original cheesecake and cousin ordered 2 other cheesecake. The slices of cheesecake were good size and comes with whipped cream on the side. I took it to go to eat at the hotel. The Cheesecake Factory cheesecake was good. Just this location was too packed with people. They need more cashiers if they want the line to move faster.

Don&#39;t ever book a large group. Our was 25+.  The room was dark and cold. The gave is 1 server. Mark the managers excuse was sorry that the way we are set up. He didn&#39;t even join in to help.  I say Mark is an excuse of a manager. He just walked away.<br><br>Finally 4 servers came out and helped. Good news. My dinner came out finally, but cold.

This is the worst restaurant I&#39;ve ever been too. The service was awful. Utensils were dirty. Waitresses were loud and obnoxious. Everyone had an attitude. Even the hostess was rude. Told us 10min wait, turned to almost an hour. Text and talking on the phone. I can tell it&#39;s nothing but poor management . Disgusting.

What a cluster f&amp;@$ to say the least. First the girl at the hostess desk was garbage. We walk in as we follow the signs, they say see the hostess to be seated. We go to desk and she asked my wife &#34;can I help you?&#34;. Yes you can by sitting us down. Second the place was hardly busy at all, but the sat us close where the doors were open and it was super humid outside. I said something to our waiter and he just said yeah it&#39;s sticky.
