The employees were super loud. Most of the time we were there sounded like a barbecue party at someone&#39;s house. We were just waiting for Lil Wayne to come cracking through the speakers. Third one of the kitchen people yelled &#34;first rule is to respect no one&#34;. Seriously The Cheesecake Factory?!? These are really the people that you have working for you? It is a shame because the food is good but I will not take my wife or myself to this ghetto, garbage place. Yes it is Baltimore but you are still serving customers and we should not have to be subject to that kind of behavior. Get it together!!!!!

I&#39;ve been to a lot of Cheesecake Factories and always ordered the same thing (Chicken and Shrimp Bangbang). Tonight I decided to try something different and got the Hibachi Steak entree. I ordered it well-done because I&#39;m pregnant. It came to me a little close to burnt. Kind of a sad face there.<br><br>For dessert, husband and I shared a slice of Toasted Marshmallow Smores Galore and it was AWESOME!!! It was my first cheesecake order in this chain and I loved it (I always skip dessert when eating out).<br><br>It was crowded as usual and we were told the wait would be 40 mins., but we didn&#39;t wait that long. Our server was just doing her job, nothing extra in her efforts (meaning just took/gave us our orders and walked away sort of thing). My lemonade was sour, but I drank it anyway. I think just the best part tonight was my date and the awesome cheesecake.

Visited here on a Saturday night around 7 the wait was about only  30 minutes ( I was very surprised). Our server was wonderful and extremely customer friendly. We ordered 2 Cajun jambalaya pastas w/ extra chicken and added mushrooms and one shrimp w/ angel hair w/ added chicken.  The Shrimp with angel hair was so flavorless I had to add damn near 2 cups of grated Parmesan cheese the waitress brought over and a pinch of salt. The menu said &#34;with a touch of marina sauce&#34;, instead it tasted like I opened a can of diced tomatoes and let it simmer before throwing in noodles and shrimp. I tasted my co-workers pastas and I&#39;d give the jambalaya a 31/2 (this was w/ cheese and a pinch of salt)  added , needless to say I will never order that again. HOWEVER, I decided to indulge in a jumbo slice of BLACK-OUT cake and lets just say I&#39;ve been craving it every since (bring this rating from a 1 &amp;1/2 or 2 to a 3 star review).  I will be going to a Virginia location for my birthday simply to treat my own self to a slice of it  !

I&#39;m a regular when it comes to Cheesecake Factory, but I have to say this has been the worst one I have dinned in. Not for the food, but only service. Hostess was clueless and totally disengaged when it came to her simple job and took us twice as long to be seated. <br>Waiter was prompt and took our orders in a timely manner, but it took one hour for the kids food and my salad to come out. Maybe it had to do with the fact that there was more laughing going on at the kitchen that work!! <br>When I asked to talk to the manager, he simply said I apologize and left out table in 30 seconds, maybe that also had to do something with the fact that he was inexperienced and looked as if he just graduated high school!!<br>Frankly, I&#39;m disappointed that a great restaurant chain in such an important location and high touristic location invests and care so little for its restaurant. <br>There are so many great restaurants around this cheese cake factory in Inner Harbor that I wouldn&#39;t waste any time dinning here again.

Strongly recommend their main course combo, salmon or shrimp and beef! We like them so much, and they really taste good and deserve the price. We went there in the afternoon, so there were few people at that time. But we still waited for a little bit long time. Other food and the services are all great, just the environment is not good enough, or not clean enough. We planned to try their cheesecake for dessert but a combo is totally enough for me. I&#39;m sure we will be there again quite soon.

Quoted an hour wait time for party of 6... Waited an hour and 45min... The staff acknowledged we had waited way longer then quoted but did not apologize or even so much as offer waters for the long wait... The noise level in the restaurant was so loud that you can&#39;t hear anyone at the table talking... Our party of 6 said &#34;what&#34; more then anything else... Overall made for a pretty miserable experience. <br><br>The server however brought it back around from what would have been a 2 star to a 3. His name was Daniel S and he did an amazing job. He got the order put in and brought out the food as it was ready so we could get some food in considering the long wait. I tend to drink 5-6 glasses of water at dinner and I never had an empty glass. <br><br>Overall I would say the restaurant atmosphere was horrible... Noise level was significantly louder then your average Cheesecake Factory and cleanliness was subpar. The bathroom was pretty horrible as well. Very dirty with wet paper towels and TP all over the floor.

We came in for lunch at the break of a dental conference at the convention center. We were promptly seated, had a wonderful server who was efficient and friendly, and had food and drinks delivered as ordered. The thing that made it EXCEPTIONAL was the waitress, unsure of my food allergy issues, had the GM stop by the table and help with gluten and vegan concerns. Takeaway = GREAT FOOD, excellent service, comfortable seating and a great choice for all of us (6).<br>I look forward to my next opportunity to eat here!

Came in for an appetizer and a piece of cheesecake. I waited 1 hr and 45 min to receive 1 out of the 2 items that I ordered. The server was unprofessional. I told her I will pay for my bill at the front counter and will pass on the cheesecake because I did not have a whole afternoon to waste. She shouted at me and demanded I pay her specifically because she was my server. I&#39;m very disappointed that she did not apologize for anything and she made a scene. The manager also did not approach to resolve the issue. I&#39;m a customer. I can spend my money anywhere and I chose to spend it here. From this experience I can tell that they do not appreciate their customers here. Completely unacceptable. An email is on its way to corporate. A blog post will also be shared on a food blog.

Sat at a dirty table with bar rag on it for several min. Waited an excessive amount of time for drinks and food. Had to send both orders back for being incorrectly prepared. My burger was burnt and so small it took up half the bun. Ingredients were missing off my girlfriends plate. Waited again a long time to get a second round of drinks. The replacement dishes took a very long time to come out. We have eaten at many cheesecake factories in the past and this was way below standard. The floor in the bathroom was filthy and no toilet paper in the holders. The bathroom trash was overflowing. And then we get handed a bill that was incorrectly rung up. After a poor dining experience, i found it disturbing to see 3 cheesecake factory kitchen staff in aprons standing on the sidewalk on pratt street coverd in food and eating out of cheesecake factory dishes and silverware. How unprofessional. No wonder the place was such a disaster.
Hiring additional staff to support a clean and sanitary restaurant is strongly recommended!! Completely unacceptable conditions!!!

I love Cheesecake Factory! It&#39;s not fine dining, but so what. The food is delicious. The Inner Harbor location is in the middle of all the action. The place was crowded, so we grabbed a seat by the bar which turned out great. Service was super fast and food was on point as usual. My steak Diane was cooked just right. The strawberry lemonade is my favorite non-alcoholic drink. Sweet and tangy at the same damn time. Definitely eat here if your in Downtown B&#39;more.

Excellent waitress who was very patient with me and my moody and under-the-weather children.  Only thing I wish is that my hubby was there to enjoy such a pleasant, delicious and well deserved late lunch/early dinner on the harbor.  <br><br>We had a great booth seat by the window/adjacent to their patio-like seating.  Even though it was extremely, nose running cold outside we were not freezing in our seats so close to the plasticy/window-ish see through material.  The booths were private and high enough that I didn&#39;t worry too much that the patrons adjacent to us on either side would be bothered by my boys fussing.<br><br>The menu is so overwhelming with pages and pages of delicious options that I almost chose something different about 3 or 4 times before settling on the filet mignon cooked medium rare and I must say it was probably the most perfectly cooked filet mignon I&#39;ve ever had and I&#39;ve frequented my share of high-end steak restaurants.  I experienced several bites that literally melted in my mouth.  I regard a steak highly that does not require any steak sauce and this one fit the bill.<br><br>The waitress was patient with me as I tried to pick a dish that would satisfy my picky youngest who wanted to try shrimp like his big brother and suggested a dish and recommended modifications to fit his picky palate.  I was set at ease to see he gobbled every last piece of shrimp and even went to his brother&#39;s side to try to scavenge from his plate as well!<br><br>We ended the meal with a slice of their beyond compare Key Lime Cheesecake --which is a MUST for any visit to the Cheesecake Factory!  My oldest got a slice of the chocolate cake --which looked decadent and mouth-watering.<br><br>I even ordered about 4 pieces of cheesecake to take To Go --including the Mango Key Lime one which I will probably not order ever again, but that&#39;s OK.  I just wanted to try it out.  The coconut flake infused crust did not meet my expectations, but if you LOVE coconut you may take to it better.<br><br>Overall, I would say this was one of the best overall experiences out with the boys at a restaurant and we will DEFINITELY be BACK!!!

Not a good experience. Our waiter was kind ride. She brought the napkins and just put on the table and did not bother to fix it properly. Then shee brought the flatware and placed  them on the top of the napkinds and she left. Very unprofessional or she was not taught how to fix a table. So sad I just wanted to enjoy a cheesecake with my mother and this waitress ruined for me by taking long time to bring our items and the place was empty so no excuse of rush.

We decided to go for some cheese cake after our dinner in Fells Point ,MD so we took at Uber to The Cheesecake Factory .  It was around 9pm on a Saturday .  The place was busy and we waited very long for our table for two.  The floors were dirty .  The men&#39;s bathroom was gross .  The kitchen area was messy on the part where they serve up the food.  They sat us right next to a couple eating .   There was no one in the area so I am not sure why they did this ????  The guests all were looking down at their cell phones ...very zombie like .   The couple sitting next to us was nice ...we learned a lot about them.  Our waitress was indifferent .   We gave an indifferent tip.  The worst part of it was that she switched my wife&#39;s coffee with mine .  It was supposed to be decaf....I got the decaf and she got the regular coffee .  It kept her up all night long .   The cheesecake was fine ....that is why this chain gets 2 stars.  1 star would be unfair because the food was good...how bad are you really going to screw up premade factory cheesecake .

So let me start out that I really like CCF. The only reason for the low rating was the wait time for our food and the heat we experienced sitting inside.  Labor Day was a humid, sunny, and at times cloudy day. I need the weather to make up its mind and stop all this foolishness!  Any-who We came here to get some good food and to catch up after having both been in Kuwait and working together.  We went here and waited 20 min for a table (no prob), we ordered our food with water (no prob) we waited on our food (PROB!!!). We waited what felt like an hour or more for basic items!! I got some scrambled eggs, English muffin, and hash browns (the potato chunky baked kind, not the shredded fried kind LOL). She got mashed potatoes and salmon.  I have no clue what they were doing in that kitchen but our food took entirely too long. Now the server who brought the food did apologize for the wait but I was still salty about it. We didn&#39;t get a refill on the water we had for all that time waiting.  They need to do better in my opinion.

I don&#39;t typically choose to go to chain restaurants very often, but a girlfriend and I went in for a drink while we waited for friends to meet us in the inner harbor. We sat outside on the patio where we listened to nearby music and looked at the water. Our server suggested a sauvignon blanc that I enjoyed very much, and I also ordered an impressively tasty iced coffee. my friend ordered a smoothie that she is still talking about. <br>Upon looking at the extensive menu, we decided perhaps an appetizer was in order. I chose the Ahi Tuna Tartare. I&#39;ve never seen such beautiful food presentation at a chain restaurant and I would definitely order it again. Our friends joined us and after looking at the menu ordered a Georgia peach , chicken Picatta, and I believe a Turtle cheese cake. All were delicious.  <br>The food was so good I strongly suggested to my husband (who had an event at the convention center that day) that we go back, he agreed and I returned with him, and I talked it up so much a group of his friends from the convention center joined us. I ordered the same wine, he ordered an iced coffee, and his friends ordered smoothies(with the same reaction as my friend had the day before). We ordered Vietnamese shrimp summer rolls (the Peanut sauce was amazing). We ordered Thai coconut lime chicken, bacon-bacon cheeseburger, Louisiana chicken pasta, pasta Napoletana, and four cheese pasta-each of which we all tasted and loved. The food was very flavorful and unique and the food presentation was beautiful. For dessert we had a lemoncello torte, lemon raspberry cheesecake, salted caramel cheesecake, black tie cheesecake, and Chris&#39;s outrageous cheesecake. All were to die for and I don&#39;t think I could even pick a &#34;favorite&#34;.<br>I can&#39;t believe I would ever say this about a chain, but The Cheesecake Factory is one of the best restaurants I&#39;ve been to in a long time. We will definitely return.

I wish I read the reviews before coming to this location. First impression was at the front desk with a lady who couldn&#39;t even lift her head up to talk to us. If it wasn&#39;t for my waiter (the only thing I can say that was positive) I would give it less stars. When I first checked in they told me would be about 10 minutes for a table. We waited well over that probably 20-25 and when I asked the front desk staff her reply was &#34;Well I don&#39;t know cause I wasn&#39;t here before&#34;. She directed us to the high top tables cuz she couldn&#39;t give an answer on how much longer it would be to wait again. I did not want to sit there but it started pouring and kids were hungry and tired of waiting. I have kids and my 5 year old fell off the high chair, got injured and No one seemed to care. Food was typical CF so that was fine. We ordered coffee and dessert to wait out the storm. Coffee came out cold, even the mug wasn&#39;t warm. Never again at this location
I used to like picking up food from here UNTIL door dash started... regular customers getting carryout orders are mostly ignored as a result.

Went on a Monday evening.  The hostess barely acknowledged we were there.  The person who seated us did not even look at us or speak.  The waitress was<br>Very friendly but told us the pipes were leaking from the restaurant above and they couldn&#39;t cook burgers.  When we asked what they could cook, we were given a long list of things they could not make.  It would have been nice to have been told when we arrived.

I thought when you find a hair in your nachos you get the nachos made again but for free. Nope I still had to pay. Anyways. It was a great outdoor seating by the harbor. I ordered the spicy guacamole nachos but after the hair they redid it but forgot to make it spicy. The pasta with shrimp was good! Key lime cheesecake.... Well I just tried it but a Lil too tart for me. Will be back next year when I go to Maryland!! <br><br>Luckily I still enjoyed my visit so I only took one star off for the Hair.

I love Cheesecake Factory. Hands down my favorite. The only issue is the extensiveness of the menu. It&#39;s overwhelming! Geez Louise. I would love to try the brunch though. Word to the wise, don&#39;t sit outside on a nice day unless you want pigeon feathers in your ish!

Being a Cheesecake Factory fan ...i was extremely disappointed in this location.<br><br>We had someone in our party who was celebrating a birthday.  We asked to be seated outside and we were.  Every now and then the breeze blew by and it smelled funky.<br><br>We ordered an app to share and then our food which included salad and miso salmon with white rice.  The app arrived and we were told the bread was coming.<br><br>The food came and was dropped off.  No salad no bread.  The salmon had brown rice.  The waiter Erin never came by to see if the food was ok.  I had to flag another waiter down to ask if he could ask Erin to come to our table.  Everyone else had finished their meals before Erin arrived.<br><br>The white rice was delivered ...we were done with our meals when the bread and salad arrived.  <br><br>One plate which still had some tomatoes and sauce was pucked up and taken away by Erin without asking if the customer was done ...which she was not.  She had been dipping bread (now that we finally received it) in the sauce.  She went so fast and didnt even look us ...so we were not able to stop her.<br><br>This is unacceptable and we got nothing more than im trying to get it out to you when we asked about the bread.   No heartfelt apology ...no visit from the manager no comps even though they knew we were there celebrating a birthday.  Not that a birthday customer should have a better experience ...but it was a special occassion.<br><br>We were so over it and ready to leave that we left the credit card behind.  When picking it up the following day ...a manager said he had it and would pull it out of the safe and would be RIGHT with us.  Fifteen minutes later ...we see the manager behind the cheesecake counter doing all sorts of things ...looking right at me on one occassion and not even acknowledging my existence.  He was on his way to the other side of the room when we grabbed him and his excuse was &#34;i got pulled in a different direction&#34;.  This from a manager?  Again ...missing out on that heartfelt apology.<br><br>Dont go there!  There are many other wonderful restaurants in the area that will want your business.  I wish I had looked at the reviews before going.  Didnt think I could go wrong with this chain ...I was wrong.

This review is for Paul Herbert-manager.<br><br>Yesterday, I had the unfortunate experience visiting this establishment.  I work for a major humanitarian organization, and I value the treatment of such practices.  Upon arriving to establishment, I ordered a drink from the bar. The glass was filthy, however the bartender was amazing about it and swapped glasses quickly. We were seated by an amazing waitresses ( the epitome of what this place should model in terms of service) named Jayla B. I selected this place as I wanted something familiar to celebrate my boyfriends work accomplishments.<br><br>Let me cut to the chase, after reviewing the menu, I selected an item that I thought were buffalo chicken blast-which I now know are discontinued thanks to Google.  However, I received something very different. After politely asking the woman (not my waitress) who set my order down what happened to the buffalo chicken blast, she rudely told me I had the wrong restaurant and did I want them or not? I I asked for my waitress, as I do not engage in someone&#39;s lack of knowledge about the history of discontinued items in the manner she presented herself.<br><br>Jayla B took our order. The food arrived unpleasantly cooked and lacked taste ( we ordered Cajun pasta with a side of Alfredo as we did this before). The manager Paul Herbert came to ask us about the meal we returned. Now, my boyfriend is a &#34;go with the flow man&#34; and even he hated it. <br><br>After telling Paul my issue , and then repeating my cold appetizer and dirty glass experience, he rudely responded, &#34;The cajun sauce is a broth (yelp readers, please note that this menu item is listed as a Cajun cream based sauce and not a broth) and the reason the meal was bad is because you added Alfredo.&#34; Shocked (as I also own a very popular catering company and work as the head chef in addition to my day job) I responded that the broth should have flavor to add decadence to the ingredients in the dish. Furthermore, me adding Alfredo (which looked like evaporated milk-guess the chef was heavy handed on the whipping cream in the sauce and forget to season the entire meal) should have complimented the dish, but such an addition was not the reason it lacked flavor and texture. I also mentioned that the sauce &#34;broth&#34; (whatever Paul mentioned) did not even hold the noodles and my dish was watery. Paul tries to convince me I was the reason I did not like it. I ask for my waitress Jayla.<br><br>Jalya, whom was AMAZING, took another order for us (please note, I have been here for two full hours now.) This meal came back terrible as well. Disgruntled, we ordered what we came for-dessert.  I asked Jayla how the bill would be handed. She said she would bring her manager.<br><br>Guess who comes back? Paul. I asked Paul how he would adjust the bill after explaining my experience with both meals, and his less than exemplary customer service and rudeness. I asked him what he should do to ensure I invite my colleagues back or how he wanted me to share my overall unsatisfactory experience at his restaurant. I added that the highlight of my evening was Jayla and how well she treated us knowing we were unhappy and did not eat a meal.<br><br>Paul kneels beside me, seeing the second meal touched by one bite of dissatisfaction. <br>This man says, &#34; I took care of the appetizer but because you ordered a second meal. You are going to pay for it.&#34; I repeated, I&#39;d be more than happy to pay for what I consumed, however, I was not paying for what I did not eat- the second meal. After moments of back and forth banter, he told me I was paying and had &#34;police on deck&#34; to handle situations like this. I did not mind him calling the police because I was the one being robbed-being charged for 2 meals not eaten. <br> <br>During this time, the dessert came (Paul went to get the bill). I had requested the dessert to be voided. Paul told Jayla to take the dessert away because I was not paying for it. Jayla looked confused, but followed the bosses orders- who lacks the competence and professionalism to have the position.<br><br>When the bill came, Paul told me he was not leaving till I payed.  He stood up beside me, and hovered over my table for the duration of this experience. <br><br>Mind you, the ONLY reason I paid was because my boyfriend dislikes confrontation of this measure and we had a flight to catch. I paid for the second meals, although I told Paul it did not meet my expectations in our earlier conversation.<br><br>He gave me his card and told me he would be okay if I shared this experience, so I am.<br><br>After this, I will call the Better Business Bureau, write Corporate and share my experience on all social medias for this location. Furthermore, every single friend and colleague will not visit this establishment when in town for business.<br> <br>I will not rest until Paul receives the necessary training, education, intelligence and empathy to be a manager of a food chain in which prides themselves​ in the customer service experience.
I really appreciate the quick service and great experience we had today at the Harbour Place.

The cheese cake takes the cake! Lol<br>I have tried about 10 different ones and no matter which you pick, they are all pleasing to the tongue!  Chocolate Tuxedo, red Velvet, Carrot Cake and Dutch Apple Carmel Streusel are some of my favorites.

The hostess at this facility was not the most friendly hostess that I have ever dealt with. She was not rude, she just was not nice. <br>The server was prompt &amp; had great suggestions but the food was terrible once it arrived an hour after we ordered. <br>With that said, we sat outside &amp; it smelled like a dirty rotten trash pile. <br>I probably would not recommend this to anyone much less eat here again.
A recent trip included dirty silverware, filthy atmosphere, and unfortunately slow service to get water....<br><br>I could have boiled the harbor water faster than this location could turn on a tap.

Honestly I don&#39;t know why all the bad reviews? Went their for lunch with my 6 month old son. We were seated at a table right away. The waitress was friendly and attentive. I ordered a mojito, bang bang chicken and shrimp, and of course a slice of turtle cheesecake. (Who doesn&#39;t go to the Cheesecake Factory and not order cheesecake?) all the food was delicious and large portions that I could not finish!

Worst experience I&#39;ve had at a Cheesecake Factory. Our server dropped our food on us. She apologized but my boyfriend was still covered in food. The club sandwich had no cheese and only turkey, the turkey burger was not cooked and the kids meal had two chicken nuggets. No one seemed to care because they were busy. We won&#39;t be back.

Went here for Sunday Brunch. To be honest, I have been in much better cheesecake factory than this one. Service was lacking. My milk had a fly in it. Pancakes were not good. The orange juice was good though. <br><br>Like any other cheesecake factory, prices are not that bad. But I wouldn&#39;t definitely go back.
The hostess at the stand was very rude. No sense of customer service. The waiter did not come to the table to help our party of 5 after we were seated for 20 minutes.

One of the worst dining experiences I&#39;ve ever had.  Just went for a bottle of wine and 2 slices of cheesecake.  Asked for the pecan cheesecake and didn&#39;t know til 25 mins later that they were out of it.  Ok no big deal, I just ordered something else.  My gf went to the restroom and comes back and tells me it&#39;s absolutely disgusting.  I go to restroom and the single stall is absolutely disgusting as well and everything is empty.... Napkins, toilet paper, etc.  I go to the front and ask for a manager to let them know about the bathrooms and sit there for 10 minutes (not exaggerating) and then just leave.  Anyways we got our check and I left my credit card in it for 20 minutes (not exaggerating) and our waiter was nowhere to be found.  My gf just left cash for the waiter and he lost a little on the tip but we couldn&#39;t wait around any longer.<br><br>They rely heavily on their location and great cheesecake and put zero effort (from what I saw) into any service.  They should be embarrassed honestly.

Love the CCF but avoid this location at all cost. Service is slow, food not anywhere near the quality and taste you expect from Cheesecake Factory. Try Burger King ,Chick Fil-A , hot dog vendor on corner and you will have more time &amp; less disappointment
The server was extremely slow and kept forgetting to refills our drinks..then would come back without item and ask us did we need them again

This is a very disappointing dinner at The Cheesecake Factory for me, and the worst. <br><br>I was here for dinner with my colleagues. We were here around 6:30pm. After waiting for 30 mins, we were seated. It took almost an hour for us to get our food!!! Most of us ordered pasta, and two had salad. The pasta came out cold, the plate was hot. I had Chicken Marsala, which hardly had any sauce and the mushrooms were partially burnt. Yes, the whole plate looked and tasted like some overcooked microwave meal. Pasta hardly had any sauce on, it tasted bland. I had to ask twice for extra sauce, and that took good 20 mins for the waitress to bring that over. By the time I got the sauce, I almost finished the second piece of chicken. Not to mention the extra sauce was cold. Overall, the Chicken Marsala was horrible, had no flavor. <br><br>The chopped salad didn&#39;t look appetizing at all. Thr lettauce was brown!!! The whole plate looked brown, not freshly green. <br><br>I had Chicken Marsala and chopped salad in other Cheesecake Factory locations. This one is the worst, not to mention, service wasn&#39;t that good either. <br><br>For $20 a plate, I expected food was hot and flavorful. <br><br>Don&#39;t waste your money here!!

Cheese is always my favorite, so I went into when I caught sight of the name. Honestly, they offer much cheesecakes more than my expectation, and the Ultimate Red and Velvet tastes good. One thing makes me less comfortable. When I sit down by the table, one waitress didn&#39;t permit because &#34; that is for those who order&#34;. It&#39;s ridiculous. Did I order no food, or did I order while I didn&#39;t sit? Damn it.

Quick review: I was accompanied by a group of eight, who passed dishes around to sample.  Gumbo, crab cakes, crusted chicken, ribeye, fish and chips, and chicken and shrimp.  My favorite dish was the medium ribeye  was cooked and seasoned superbly.  My least favorite  was the crab cakes.  The crab cakes were mostly filler and very little crab.  More of a corn filling flavor.  On a positive note the waiter was attentive and she was informative.

Cheesecake Factory remains in my top list of chain restaurants to partake in.  Their excellent quality appears to remain the same across the board.  Whether it be on vacation in Baltimore, MD or back home in Lil&#39; Rhody, you&#39;re sure to encounter exceptional service and mouthwatering meals.  This is a reassuring this to have, especially when you aren&#39;t sure where you can grab a tasty meal wherever you happen to be.  <br><br>The menu is ridiculously extensive, leaving you with a top 3 - 4 things you&#39;d like to order.  They overestimated our wait by about 30 minutes, which was a pleasant surprise.  We were seated outdoors, under a canopy, with a beautiful view of the inner harbor.  Fans created a gentle breeze creating a relaxing and enjoyable atmosphere in this crowded restaurant.  <br><br>It was here the bf and I decided to partake in this locale&#39;s famed crab cakes. . . and tasty they were.  The chicken teriaki entree is packed with flavor, though I could have done without the grilled fruits adorning the edges of the plate.  While I would have loved to over-indulge in a plating of cheesecake, I was filled to the brim with my main meal.  There is no way anyone could eat all the food they serve in one sitting.  Had we been planning on setting back to the hotel, I would have certainly wrapped it up for a second visit.  <br><br>I recommend this place to both locals and tourists who find themselves in the area.  And props to the poor waiter who had to deal with the awfully picky party seated behind us. . . .

We came too Cheesecake Factory which we love and we sat down it took roughly 10 min for a waiter too finally greet us so I&#39;m thinking during the wait he is getting bread or even water but brings nothing we ask for water and bread and wait another 15 minutes for that and than we make a order for appetizers and get those 20 min later and finally we decide to place a hour which took a surprisingly hour ! Food was Fresh bread was slightly warm
Busy time of day or not this place is definitely not worth going to. Omg sigh poor table service and guess what- if you are short handed- keep the drinks coming!

My girlfriend and I did not have a long wait time. Our server was polite and attentive. We enjoyed our meals until we saw a mouse running across the floor.<br><br>We immediately informed our server who admirably took accountability and apologized. Because my girlfriend&#39;s appetite was ruined, she did not finish her meal.<br><br>The manager did come speak with us and gave us a corporate response. &#34;They have pest control come out regularly to minimize issues like this&#34;. He proceeded to ask us for our contact information to send to his corporate office. We respectfully declined and requested that the meal that my girlfriend had not finished eating be comped.<br><br>The manager obliged and our entire meal was comped. While we appreciate how the manager resolved this matter we will not be visiting that location again.<br><br>Kind Regards,<br><br>-Disgusted guest

My boyfriend and I came here for dinner and the minute we walked in we were treated extremely nice. The employees were all so kind, funny and sweet. My boyfriend is vegan and when we asked about a certain food our waiter (Darrius) had the manager ( Anthony)  come over and explain the dish to us. My boyfriend then asked if there was another vegan option he suggested and the manager gave us a few options. Next, we were curious about another dish and another waiter answered our question no problem! Our food was delicious as always! Darrius was super funny and personable! We loved it here! Thanks for the great experience!!!

I&#39;m generally a harsh critic when it comes to chains.  There&#39;s a lack of consistency with the food, ridiculous wait times, inflated prices and poor service.  Generally speaking, Cheesecake Factory can fit that description at different points.  Once in a while though, they can get things right.  This was one of those times!<br><br>This Cheesecake Factory location is at the Inner Harbor section of Baltimore, overlooking the water.  From a physical standpoint, the restaurant is not a stand alone location but actually is in a small mall of sorts that&#39;s in the middle of the Harbor scene.  The mall itself is basically a tourist trap with a couple of restaurants and stores that sells refreshments as well as memorabilia.  <br><br>Came to this location after the speedboat disaster.  My date emerged from the boat looking fairly presentable....minus a few hairpins and one set of eye lashes.  Nothing that dim lighting can&#39;t fix!<br><br>We entered the restaurant and were given a wait time of 15-20 minutes.  As you would expect, there were several tourists packing the place.  So what do you do when you&#39;re stuck in a packed lobby with a date who has more detachable parts than a Mrs. Potato Head toy?  Start looking at the cheesecake display cases!!  So many flavors looking oh so good!<br><br>We were finally seated and started putting in our orders.  Since we had lunch not too long ago, drinks and desserts were on the agenda.  It was also the safe choice because let&#39;s face it, cheesecake is the only thing this chain does consistently well.  Our waitress was friendly and fairly prompt as she took our orders and served us during our stay.<br><br>I ordered the raspberry lemonade, which was amazing.  Very tart with a hint of sweetness from the sugary rim of the glass.  I think I had 4-5 glasses.  I don&#39;t know if I was being drugged but that stuff was like liquid crack.  The waitress did quip about putting me on restriction after my 3rd cup but one look at my dilated pupils and she made like a good dealer and kept the &#34;stuff&#34; coming.  <br><br>We ordered the hershey and red velvet cheesecakes.  Very generous portions means happy days in my world!!  The red velvet was nice to look at and tasted good.  I&#39;m not the biggest red velvet fan because it&#39;s more savory than sweet but that&#39;s just a preference.  The Hersey on the other hand is likely to be banned by the American Diabetes Association.  Chocolate upon chocolate upon chocolate.  It was really good but honestly, it might have been too much chocolate....gasp....if there is such a thing.  <br><br>Like any other tourist trap, it felt like the prices were a little inflated but either way, it&#39;s not a bad option in a high volume sight seeing location where many of the other choices specialize in highway robbery!
Absolute horrible service . I wish I read some of the reviews before coming here!!! Spot on regarding the smell and the basic entree like chicken parm was awful!!!

My only issue is the utensils are laid out on the table and I witnessed a server wipe the seat with the same cloth he used to wipe the table.  That disgusting to me.  Needless to say my group requested disposable utensils.  The food was good.

If you are out late and looking for something to put your belly it&#39;s okay. If you looking to satisfy your taste buds, keep on walking. <br><br>My family and I came here because it was open till late. It was convenient but after this experience, I think there may be better options.<br><br>Our waitress was playing a weird game of hide and seek with us. And we ended up flagging down different people whenever we wanted to order something.<br><br>I guess she was hiding from the kitchen staff too because when she finally appeared with the bread it was stone cold. Same goes for our entrées. We got our steak then sides of fries and asparagus followed 20 minutes later. <br><br>As for quality, my Cajun chicken pastas was bland and came out black in color. Even the cheese cake was just meh.<br><br>Maybe we will come back for the Fourth of July to watch the fireworks here but I don&#39;t think will be ordering more than drinks and appetizers.

Great food. Great location, portions match prices and the best desserts around. The only down fall of this place is the loud inconsiderate clientele. Management seems to ignore people who play music from their phones at the tables and those that complain loudly in the bar. They should be immediately confronted and asked to be considerate or leave. TIP - do not sit in the bar area if it can be helped. There are great servers there but terrible customers.

Stopped through the Inner Harbor en route back home. The Cheesecake Factory is the devil&#39;s den filled with culinary delights that totally wrecked my meal plan for the week. Who can go there and eat rabbit food.  I totally indulged and will have to scale back during the week and add more cardio on the elliptical.  Oh well-  the Avocado Egg Rolls,  Chicken Madeira and lemon meringue cheesecake was soooooooo good. Oh and the server was quite attentive.
Came here for appetizers before the baseball game and had great service with the food also being fantastic. Thanks Daniel

Not great.  1. It was hot.  We waited 35 minutes for an indoor table but it was barely cooler than being in the sun.  There were empty tables, tons of staff and we still waited over an hour for our food.  We got to Cheesecake factories in unfamiliar areas because we always know what to expect.  After eating at them all over the country this one was the worst.
Plus: Great view of the harbour; street musician playing out front.<br><br>Minus: long wait for food and meal had no flavor. How do you make a cajan dish with no flavor?

Went to pickup 2 pieces of carrot cake. After ordering and waiting for order we witnessed some really unhygienic things. An employee was preparing 3 strawberry cheesecakes. She came from the back of house with gloves on her hands. She talked to some co-workers (rubbing her gloved hands all over the counter top as she talked) then began sorting strawberries at the counter with same gloves. She then got her purse out from behind counter and went through it then went back to picking through the strawberries with the same gloved hands. <br>My friend and I were in disbelief at how nasty this was.

I&#39;ve been hearing about the Cheesecake Factory for some time.  My wife suggested we dine here on date night sometime.<br><br>So there we were at the Inner Harbor, my daughter and I, looking for a place to dine.  we saw this and thought, &#34;Why not?&#34;<br><br>Yuck!<br><br>The menu is huge.  I had a Cuban sandwich, my daughter pasta.  She wouldn&#39;t finish her dish.  Mine was the blandest Cuban I have ever had.  <br><br>Service was weak.  We were not a priority to the waitress.  We skipped dessert, hence the cheesecake.  Admittedly, they looked in the case.  I&#39;ll never know, however, as I&#39;ll never dine at this chain again.  There was nothing distinctive about the menu at all.

Worst customer service especially the front desk lady has the worst attitude!! We were told the wait was 30 minutes but were waiting over an hour &amp; when we asked what was taking so long she responded with &#34;why don&#39;t u go clean the table and set it up yourself&#34;

Very disappointed in the way they handled things. They are very unorganized. We waited 50 mins to be seated which wasn&#39;t the problem. While waiting, 3 different parties that checked in after us were called ahead first before us.

My experience at this location today. After a long wait to be seated which was okay because I really wanted to eat there. I finally got a table outside to eat however I never got served. I sat there for 25 mins and no one came to at least offer me water or bread. The location is nasty specifically the outdoor tables. Pigeons were everywhere on top of tables walking on the napkins and plates. Anyone (non restaurant customers) can walk in and out of the outdoor section. And I mean anyone you name it. Many waiters and waitresses walked past my table as well as the group who was seated next to me the same time I got seated. After realizing that this cheesecake location was not deserving of my time or my money I just left. I will never come to this location again. No customer service at all.

Stopped by for coffee and a snack. Incredibly rude staff. No one greeted me. Asked for a latte. Rudely told me that machine was broken. Asked for a cappuccino. Rudely said that wasn&#39;t available even though it is made with espresso. Finally got an espresso and a carrot cake. Then they turned the register off by mistake. Waited for a while for it to turn on. Had to ask for cream and sugar. Actually mixed my drink myself at the cash register while waiting for the register to turn back on. Paid $14 for an espresso and a slice of cake! No utensils were given. Asked if I could sit in the bar area to eat. Was told that my order was to go even though I didn&#39;t order to go. I am sitting in the bar area writing this review. This place probably gets business because of it&#39;s location. I would not come back here. The service is abysmal to non existent. It is not even rush hour. Only reason for the one star is because the cake is actually good. Charm City my butt! Hmph!!

Waiters are friendly and attentive. We ate at a high table in the bar section to not have to wait for a table in the main room and enjoyed a relaxed ambiance, despite the noise from the other room. <br>We got a few starters instead of regular meals and we didn&#39;t expect to get so much food. The food was amazing. <br><br>Cocktails are fine but way overpriced for what it is. I wish the restaurant was less noisy.

I love the cheesecake factory. The food was good. The only problem I have was that the utensils was dirty. I had steak, mash potatoes and spinach. It was great no complaints. The waiter was great. I dont really remember her name. I had a big chocolate cake that I was surprised with because of course it was my birthday. I had a wonderful time. I will go back. Maybe not in MD because I was on a vacation, but in NY if its not crowded.

I ordered the herb crushed salmon and i was very disappointed with the salmon! The salmon was very bland, no flavor whatsoever and fishy taste. Worst salmon I had in a long time! For dessert I ordered the Linda chocolate cake and it was absolutely Devine!

The food was pretty good. The table was a bit sticky and not thoroughly cleaned.  I guess what made this a 1 star review was the hint of raw sewage wafting through the place. Other guest mentioned it. Not sure what was going on.
There for business. The bartender was great and the food was up to par. Very small inside but service was great and cheese cake was packed to go

This is like all the other cheesecake factories as far as food. The menu, the giant slices of cake, etc. So this review will not comment on the food. <br>In other news.... The view out of the restaurant is of the harbor, and when you go during the convention weekends, it&#39;s really fun to sit there and watch all the dressed up people walk around the harbor. I accidentally went one weekend during otakon, and got to see people dressed up in all sorts of costumes.

Were here with a group of us this week. This was lunchtime. It took over an hour for us to be served, and then we had to gulp it down so we were back to work in time.<br><br>In short, this is a f--ing tourist trap. If you have 3-4 hours to spend on a lovely summer&#39;s day, go for it. Otherwise, avoid it at all costs.<br><br>Mediocre, boring, chain restaurant food. The long menu does nothing to improve on the fact that their food just SUCKS.<br><br>The Sysco truck that parked there should have been my first clue...

I&#39;ll admit it.<br>I&#39;m a fan of the Cheesecake Factory even though I hate cheesecake.<br><br>I was treated to diner here with a friend on a beautiful afternoon Sunday.<br>We got there around 6ish and was told there would be a 45 minute wait so we walked around for a while and was seated almost exactly 45 minutes later.<br><br>I started with the Roadside Sliders (8.95) yum, about 4 or 5 palm sized tasty sliders cooked to my requested medium rare, very tasty.<br>My friend had the Crab cake app,(12.95) it looked great.<br><br>For my entree I did the Chicken and Shrimp Gumbo (16.95) a great dish of spicy chicken,shrimp and diced ham served over a bed of brown or white rice. I like.<br><br>My friend did the Cajun Jambalaya,(16.95) quite good as there was little talking while we feasted.<br> <br>The iced tea here is some of the best tea I&#39;ve had in a restaurant. the bread is delish too. <br><br>For dessert I tried the Lemoncello Creme Torte,(6.95) wow. I loved it.<br>My dining companion took some cheesecake home.<br><br>The check was about 100 bucks.<br><br>Our server Jenell, (hope that&#39;s spelled right) was the quintessential experienced waitress.<br>She had a bunch of tables but but we never felt neglected or wanted for anything.She handled being extremely busy with grace and balance. I wish more servers could do the same.<br><br>Great view, Great food, and amazing service..<br><br>Two big thumbs up for the Cheesecake Factory!

My favorite place for dinner on the Harbor! I&#39;ve been 3-4 times for dinner over the past week as it is very close to where I&#39;m staying. The prices are fair for the area, but the 3 things that really set this place apart are...<br>1) the Service - you may have a short wait during busy times, but it&#39;s definitely worth it! <br>All 3 servers I&#39;ve had were friendly, professional, and responsive. Even had a manager walking by offer to refill my drink.<br>2) the Food - all 3 dinner dishes have been served hot, fresh, and delicious! I&#39;ve found the entrees to be very flavorful. <br>3) the Desserts - it deserves it&#39;s own recognition. They sport a very impressive assortment of desserts to crown the evening out, especially if one is a fan of cheesecake! <br>Enjoy!

We didn&#39;t have the greatest waiter in the world-clearly he was having a cranky day. <br><br>That being said, I love this franchise and the food. I like almost anything on their insanely large menu. We went for lunch-then to the aquarium-then grabbed cheesecake to go. We went on a weekday and got a table for 2 with no wait-which was nice. <br><br>The location is obviously fabulous-right on the inner harbor, and if it&#39;s a nice day-ask to be seated outside. The location is relatively small but a good amount of tables are outside.<br><br>I don&#39;t live anywhere near this location but would go again-and will go to the Cheesecake factory near me when I get the craving :D
Not even one star!!<br>Service was so bad...<br>Our group was sitting outside and the busboy was too loud to throw all the dishes and the waiter was not listening.  No more!!

I came to the Cheesecake Factory as a party of 1 so although it was packed I was seated immediately. I was greeted by a server in the first few mins and asked what I wanted to drink. My experience went downhill from there. My server didn&#39;t return to take my order for 15 mins. It took another 10 mins for bread, and after being in the restaurant for nearly an hour with three tables around me full of people who had yet to be served I left. Grant it, it is Sunday and very busy but the service (and my server) were moving at a pond waters pace. I will not return.
Went to TCF while visiting Baltimore and wasn&#39;t disappointed.  Food was great, server was friendly, and the cheesecake was awesome. :)

Excellent food. Very large portions. Expect to wait. Avoid sitting by the food prep area. Really loud and it sounded as if we were eating in the kitchen. When mentioned to the manager it didn&#39;t get better.

This is a very unfortunate Cheesecake Factory location. I feel it has a lot of great potential, but need stronger management in terms of training staff on hospitality. I&#39;ve only dined here once and it will be my last time. <br><br>We arrived around 3:00 pm on a Saturday to catch a late lunch. We only ended up there because the place I really wanted to go to had weekend happy hour (La Tasca), but it didn&#39;t start until 4pm. We didn&#39;t feel like waiting a whole hour, so we decided to brave the crowd at Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>Since there was a 45 minute wait for a table, we sat in the bar area - which we were told - was attended to by a waiter. We noticed when we sat down there was the folder that contains the check and 50 cents laying on our table. We were surprised someone would leave such a crappy &#34;tip&#34;; however, we should have taken it as an omen. A sign sent from God to run far...far away from The Cheesecake Factory!<br><br>We saw the waiter a couple of times, he visited several other tables but it took him 15 minutes to come to our table and take our drink orders. It took him another 15 minutes to make it back to the table. Bread...10 minutes...taking our food order another 10 minutes...we were trying to be patient. We know that we were sitting in the bar area, but we saw him talking to other parties. We were more confused than anything -- why would he talk to other patrons, but not to us? I blame my personal lack of confrontation on the sheer fact that I was terribly hungry.<br><br>After finally coming back to our table to take our meal orders we noticed it took the server a while to actually put them into the computer. I finished my drink and wanted another, but he had not returned to the bar area. I approached the bartender and tried to order a cranberry juice. She was very rude and even hostile! The lady wouldn&#39;t even pour me a cranberry juice; mind you I&#39;m hungry, thirsty and very tired of waiting at this point. I even tried to explain to her that we had been waiting a long time, but she cut me off and told me order it from my server. She summoned the same server to the bar area, told him that I wanted a cranberry juice and he brought it over...5 minutes later (eye roll.) <br><br>When I received my food it wasn&#39;t hot, meaning it probably had been sitting in the kitchen for quite a while. It tasted good, but it kind of doesn&#39;t make up for the fact that we received such poor service. I was too hungry to send it back, but we did let him know it was cold and that we felt we waited for a very long time.<br><br>The only reason we didn&#39;t ask for a manager was because it was too busy. The restaurant side was crazy, and disorganized so we can only imagine the problems guests may have been experiencing. Next time, if I&#39;m ever in Baltimore I&#39;ll stick to my gut and wait the additional hour for La Tasca to open up!

The Cheesecake factory chain is pretty much the same anywhere you go. I&#39;ve gone to quite a few, and it&#39;s always a safe option, with generous portions and good food if you pick the right choices. <br>Unfortunately, this one in inner harbor is no exception to some of the Cheesecake downsides, including not accepting reservations for small groups and the long waits for a table and for dinner to come out. It&#39;s in a good location if you&#39;re coming from public transportation, but a little hard to find parking. (Of course, this is inner harbor.)<br><br>You get a bread basket with butter as you&#39;re waiting for your food. The dark bread is always gone in a second. <br>The menu itself is very overwhelming if you&#39;re a first timer. My go-to&#39;s are usually the pastas, specifically: <br>-Louisiana Chicken Pasta<br>-Evelyn&#39;s Favorite Pasta<br>-Pasta Da Vinci<br>(-Cajun Jambalaya)<br>Otherwise, specialties and burgers are good. Salads are nice, but I find that the prices are a little too high for what you get. <br><br>Cheesecake recs <br>(note: I always go for those that are not super heavy, as the red velvet and 30th anniversary chocolate are):<br>-Godiva is always a winner for rich, dark chocolatey goodness<br>-Banana Cream <br>-The Original/Strawberry<br>-Reese&#39;s Peanut Butter Chocolate Cake for something interesting (slightly heavy)

I&#39;m torn with my review. The wait was tolerable at 30 minutes. Our server was prompt to greet us. There were 4 of us- 2 adults and 2 teenagers. Our drinks were brought promptly. Our appetizer and salads were poorly timed as they came out a mere 5 minutes before our meals. The food was really good though. A manager came out to alert my friend that her tortillas were an issue in the kitchen and would be right out. He did apologize. Our server told us that there was an issue as well. 30 minutes later came her meal. We got no further apologies and no offer to comp her meal or free dessert or anything. As often as my family eats out there is generally a gesture of apology for our inconvenience. I&#39;m bothered by the lack of care and empathy. Our total bill was $130.
The crab balls was great the dynamic shrimps wasn&#39;t all that booo.The atmosphere was cool near the harbor site.

Like all Cheesecake Factories, they are consistent in what they bring out to the table. You will get a nice experience and if you sit outside by the water, even better. The best meal service is brunch on sundays.

I really enjoyed the atmosphere of this Cheesecake Factory! But above all was the food! Amazing and indeed delicious! The service was good, where I was seated was a little cold but other than that it was simply amazing! Go try if you&#39;ve never been especially if you&#39;re not from Baltimore city the view of the harbor is beautiful at night!

I find it hard to go wrong when going to The Cheesecake Factory, especially for appetizers, drinks and dessert. This was the sole purpose of our trip to this location, and like all of my previous CF dining experiences this one did not disappoint. The wife and I kept it very simple with a Long Island Iced Tea for her and a Margarita for me. For eats, we had the Fried Mozzarella to satisfy the salty and the Red Velvet Cheesecake to satisfy the sweet. Perfection! <br><br>For the modest price we paid, we left very satisfied and we were happy with the service. This place like all other CF&#39;s gets super busy, so first come seating at the bar or high top tables makes for a quicker in-and-out dining experience. Overall, another great experience. Will definitely be back to this location and any others when the cravings hit!

When we first got there, the hostess was laughing with the servers &amp; didn&#39;t acknowledge us for about 5mins. We were sat in a booth near the server area. The staff was laughing, singing, and making a lot of noise. We could barely hear our group speaking. Not something you should hear in a restaurant from staff members. Our food was average compared to other Cheesecake Factory locations. My brother had a pasta that came out DRY. Not sure if there&#39;s a manager there or not but from the looks of it I understand why this location isn&#39;t well reviewed. Change your staff or tell them to shut up and be professional around customers.

We originally planned to eat at Phillips, a nearby seafood restaurant. Sadly, it was closing by the time we arrived, so we made a quick change of plans and headed over to The Cheesecake Factory. Was elated this location stays open later than the nearby dining establishments. We were seated immediately and served without hesitation. Our server went out of her way to please us, especially my very picky 14 year old and nobody was disappointed with their meal. Sadly, we passed on the 3000 calorie dessert.

Let me save you the trouble: go somewhere else. Sorry if this is a bit long winded, but here is a snapshot of our visit. <br>The restaurant is dirty, dirty floors, smudged glass, overflowing garbage in ladies room, wet gross sink area and the lights have layers of dust. <br>The service was awful. When we were sat down it took a while for our server to even acknowledge us and even longer to get us drinks and take our order.<br>Thankfully my daughters mac and cheese came out fast and it was actually delicious! <br>We ordered the chicken taquitos for an appetizer, they came out on a hot plate and were comically bad. They were squishy and the filling was very bland. It was also smothered in tomatoes and sitting in some sort of sauce that I&#39;m sure destroyed the integrity of the taquito, but I wasn&#39;t even interested in picking it up to investigate. <br>When our food came out my husbands shrimp scampi was lukewarm at best. The pasta was stuck together and had the shrimp actually been warm would have probably been very good. The plate was screaming hot so it obviously sat under the warmer lights for a while. <br>I got the Thai lettuce wraps as my entree. I&#39;ve had them before at other locations and love them hence me ordering it again. The components looked fine, but the chicken had big chunks of burnt pieces (probably the sugar in the seasoning, but it was black... eww). <br>When we let the waitress know the taquitos were not good she said &#39;oh, they were nasty?&#39; Umm... yeah that&#39;s why we didn&#39;t eat them, so then she took them and disappeared. We sat for a few minutes just wanting our check so we could leave. After a while my husband went and tracked down a manager who was very nice and apologetic, but it was almost too little too late. <br>As a consolation prize he brought us two pieces of strawberry cheesecake. My husband is allergic to strawberries, go figure...

Went here while in town, the server was friendly but the service was slow.  The restaurant was clean and had a nice casual atmosphere, very child friendly to my three year old. <br><br>The food was okay, I ordered a mushroom burger and it was good, no complaints.  My wife got the spicy cashew chicken, she said it was bland and not very spicy.  We got a chicken tender with fries for my son, it was good but came 20 mins before our food.<br><br>My hometown Cheesecake Factory is better than this one in the Inner Harbor, but not bad overall.

This is the third Cheesecake Factory restaurant my husband and I have visited. We were told to expect a 50 minute wait but were seated in about a half hour. The food was excellent, as is always the case at the Cheesecake Factory. Our waitress was friendly enough, but was a bit on the slow side. I would suggest investing in a few more waitstaff since it is clear they are understaffed during the busiest hours. <br><br>My biggest complaint is smoke from the outdoor seating area coming inside. Now I know it is legal for patrons to smoke outside, but I do think the restaurant should re-think the layout of the outdoor seating, so that the indoor diners are not as affected. We could smell the smoke every time the door was opened, and it was pretty bothersome.

Yesterday my two grandkids and my friend from San Diego went here for a late lunch. It was 230pm. It took 30 minutes to get some bread after we asked 3 times. It was moving in slow motion. No silverware when our food came! Kept asking for silverware drink refills multiple times before they actually came. The group in back of us ordered a veggie burger. They apologized that it was delivered to the wrong table but assured him they would get him one out asap. A few minutes later they told him they had run out of veggie burgers! I paid our $125 check left a minimal tip and asked for the manager. 15 minutes no one comes( I guess I shouldn&#39;t have paid until he came).  I went to find a manager Lufonte Brooks who had the nastiest short man complex ever. Didn&#39;t say oh sorry for that! Just that he just got here so basically it wasn&#39;t his problem! Told me he would check to see what happened. I said and then what? He said there&#39;s nothing I can do you paid already and we are busy. I also tried to talk to Paul Herbert another manager who said there was nothing they could do. I called home office! If you have a problem there call home office: 8188713000

I had yet another great dining experience here. Once again the food and service was pretty good. My only complaint is that while the service was very kind, they were also very slow. We asked for outdoor seating because we saw several empty tables, but we were rod that we would have a long wait. We did, but once were seated our server was relatively quick.

Cheesecake Factory is hit or miss for me. They have a HUGE menu with literally about 100 dishes in it. <br><br>The food is just okay to me. However, I have friends and family who have loved their food so maybe I just ordered the wrong things!<br><br>The cheesecakes are absolutely delicious!! Sinfully delicious.....it&#39;s worth going just for them. I might need to go again soon....

Today was my daughter&#39;s 13th birthday and we were so thrilled to get a slice of cheesecake. We took a special trip to Baltimore so she could do some shopping with her best friend Rachel. After our shopping we decided to grab a slice of cheesecake from the factory. We ordered the 30th anniversary cheesecake and were SO disappointed. I can&#39;t believe they chose that cheesecake as their anniversary slice. It was so nasty! Next time they need to chose a more popular and flavorful option for me and my girls
I like their food and environment.  The service was good.  If you like the cheesecakes, you&#39;ll have several options to try.
The food was really salty, and unevenly cooked, the service is mediocre in all 2 stars nothing more.

Every year we come to Baltimore it&#39;s our tradition to have our last meal at the Cheesecake Factory. They have 1001 things to choose from and they always get it right. The food tastes great and the price is definitely reasonable for the amount of food you get. The customer service is second to none and Michelle made it that much better. SHOUT OUT TO MICHELLE!!

Three months ago I&#39;d never been to a Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>Now I&#39;ve been four times. And I&#39;m obsessed with fried mac and cheese balls.<br><br>Please note that I don&#39;t live in a city with a Cheesecake Factory. And I don&#39;t have a car. So it&#39;s kind of an extra impressive/extra chubby feat.<br><br>Our wait was only about 20 minutes during prime dinner time on a Tuesday. The food was the same type that I&#39;ve had in San Fran and Richmond, but my party had a really awesome waitress here. Jackee was attentive and nice and offered to split the bill seven ways without even an eye-roll.

Terrible service. Everyone in our area of the bar looked disgusted with the lack of effort. It took 15 minutes to get the menus. 10 minutes for a beer and wine. Food arrived 20 minutes later. Now we have two apps and two empty glasses. No water. No waiter. He is folding silverware while chatting up the bartender. The restaurant is easily 75% full. I wave him over, ask for more drinks and he goes away for 10 minutes before returning. I had to ask for the bill once we cleaned the plates and stacked them neatly with my wallet on the table. The bill was 51 bucks. Wasn&#39;t worth 25. Avoid like the plague. I&#39;ve never seen such a large group of careless employees.

Went to the Cheesecake Factory yesterday evening for an early Valentine&#39;s Day celebration with my girlfriend.  The place was nice and crowded on a beautiful February Saturday.  We had a 30-40 wait at 3:30 but that was no big deal as we&#39;ve been here before and it&#39;s worth it.  Our drinks were great, appetizer was good was main meals were amazing.  The prices seem to be a little on the high side, but it is a tourist area in Baltimore.  We&#39;ll definitely be back.

I took 3 of my friends for a birthday celebration.  This is a fantastic place for special occasions.  We had 2 different appitizers appitizers each a different entree. Great for sharing bites. Of course we topped it off with cheesecake. I have never been dissapointed. Love this location also.

Excellent food, HORRIBLE service. The hostesses are VERY rude. I&#39;m sitting here still waiting for our waitress to come back so we can ask for boxes and dessert, but we are not even sure we want dessert based on how long it takes to even get a drink!

Remember that regardless of the location or increase in price for popularity, this chain has huge portions. Our waiter, unfortunately, was just out of training and our appetizers showed up after our meals. Management was great about canceling those items. The dinner was great and our waiter did his best.

I don&#39;t even know where to start off at. First of all we walked in and we were a party of 10 and we over heard one of the servers saying &#34;oh no I&#39;m taking them they have too many kids&#34; but we just let it go. They sat us down on this super dirty table, all the silverware were DISGUSTING!! They still had food on them but we each cleaned it ourselves, with hope that everything else would be great. Our server was nice but we noticed he had a lot of tables so his service was awful. We needed refills and we had to ask another employee to fill them up. We also had to get up and ask for cheese because he would come to check on our table every 20 min (mind you we were in there for over 2 hours) we ordered our entree and it took over an hour to come out. When it finally comes out my food was wrong. So that was another 20 min for them to change it. This experience was horrible, I WILL NEVER RETURN HERE. Save yourself the headache and eat at another restaurant.

Cody the bartender was phenomenal with his work ethic and his drive for customer service.   He made certain that satisfied with my experience.  The crab and artichoke dip is the best I have had for this trip and appears to be a special for Baltimore.
Very good place to eat anytime of the day. Went here with my boyfriend &amp; loved everything. The strawberry lemonade was on point.

After being told the wait was about 30-40 minutes, we decided to stick it out. 50 minutes later, we were finally seated. After that the service was decent. Our food came out fairly fast. We did have to wait almost 10 minutes to get refills of our water though. The food was great and so was the cheesecake. <br><br>This place is great if you don&#39;t mind waiting a very long time to be seated. The food will not disappoint.

I really love this restaurant because of their very extensive menu. They have breakfast all day and gourmet dishes that include something for everyone! Every item I have tried was delicious to the extreme. It is surely worth any wait. <br>The only problem could be the parking which is on the street or in the paid lot. If you are in Northern Baltimore, the Towson restaurant is an option too.<br>The Cheesecake Factory is way more than just desert.

alright, here goes - this place is THE BEST! The menu is literally the size of a new york city phonebook.  There are so many different options, that if you ate here every day, it would take 6 years to try everything they have to offer.  Picky eater in the family?  Bring him because there is literally something for everyone here!  Birthday? Celebrate it with the CCF! The wait staff comes out to your table and sings to you.  We went on my birthday and I was given a complementary slice of cheesecake that tasted as if it were baked in heaven by God.  I look forward to my next trip :)

MANAGEMENT: take notice of this review.<br><br>Food: excellent<br>Staff: excellent<br>Décor: excellent<br>Price: moderate<br>Staffing policy: ILLEGAL and Immoral. <br><br>If your waitperson serves you for 45 minutes, then there is a shift change, the replacement (who may only serve you the bill) gets the tip. UNFAIR.<br><br>Dear CCF CEO, do all the work, then let me come in and sign a few papers...and give me your salary. TADA!

This place is the worst Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve ever been to. This location gives Cheesecake Factory a bad name. For starters I decided to go to the bar while we wait, I asked for a sangria with no liquor (wine,juice,sprite) the bartender told me she could not make it because it was already pre-made. It seriously not that hard to pour all of those ingredients into a glass. The wait was 40 minutes, so my party of 7 decided to sit in the lounge area. The service in the lounge was okay. The server was very nice but he did get busy and I felt like he got overwhelmed. Appetizers arrived in a timely manner. Our Entrees took longer then usual. Two Entrees arrived then 10 minutes later three burgers arrived. The top bun on two burgers were as hard as a rock, I&#39;m sure the burgers sat in the kitchen window waiting for someone to run. I asked for mayonnaise and it never arrived. Two burgers weren&#39;t cooked right. I notified the server and he bought it to the managers attention. The manger came over to the table which was a total waste. I let him know about the bartender and all he did was make excuses for her poor customer service and he was just as bad if not worst. He never helped the server who seemed to be overwhelmed in my opinion he was not a very good leader.

This had to be the worst place, I decided to go spend my hard earn money on a Sunday afternoon. <br>We sat ourselves at the high chairs which was  not a issue since the place was extremely busy. So we sat down waited for 15 minutes, the waiter came expressed about the soup of the day. We listen to that and asked whats good on the menu. Waiter told us about the few items which was blah, so we went with our choices. Which anyone can relate to.<br>1. We ordered the shrimp rolls which was very greasy to the point which our hands were super oily. We bearly could of eaten them because they were dripping of oil.<br>2. The dynamite shrimp tasted like imitation shrimp, and breaded to the point where we had to strip the bread off to try it. That was uneatable as well. <br>3. The so called - potato tots was verrrrry nasty and super oily. If you want to get a clogged artery, and have high cholesterol go this place.<br>4. We got there at 4pm, waiter brought our drinks at 4:35. Got bread at 5:15pm. Then took our order for 3 basic appetizer. I could of went to PF Chang&#39;s and enjoyed the service and food but wanted to try the hype behind this place. It was a very nasty, poor customer service, and horrible place to enjoy food. The crazy part is that I didn&#39;t want to write a review but the service &amp; food was so disgusting that I felt compelled too.

Worst host and hostess I&#39;ve met. Went in on Sep 10 @ 9.30 pm. <br>Brought us to an occupied table and blamed it on customers. <br>Did not hide bad attitude. Manager was apologetic hence the 2 stars. Food took close to 30 min to deliver. <br>Flatbread crust too crunchy and oily. <br>Most of other orders were good. <br>Waiter was decent.<br>Cheesecakes quite good. <br>Restaurant not recommended for dinner. Manager seems like he&#39;s trying hard and has good attitude. But replace the inept host/reception staff.

Used to be alright, service has been tanking lately.  Drinks aren&#39;t mixed well but some of the time the food comes out well, the cheesecake&#39;s the sole reason to visit.  (Edit for the business comment: we did talk to the manager about it but he seemed uninterested)
Uuhhh...food looks and taste horrible. ..a roach was at our table. ..drinks was sorry! Nothing like the other two locations!

A nice place near the harbor my seating area had a nice view of the water. I understand this place is busy there was a time I waited for some time Im giving this a 3 star as there was a child crying next to my table so it ruined my mood...

This Cheesecake Factory is the bomb! This is as good as it gets for a diner style experience. I would compare their menu length to the bible, hence there is no trouble finding something on the menu for everyone. <br><br>I ordered The Classic Burger. It was a gigantic chop house hamburger. Served with a slice of grilled red onion, lettuce, tomato and french fries. It was by far the best burger I have ever had. Cooked to my perfection, very tender and juicy. And the fries were also amazing. We ordered red velvet cheesecake for dessert, which was huge and split among three people. Which was also very delicious.<br><br>On top of the awesome food was the awesome service. I asked our waitress early on if they had onion rings and ranch dressing, in which she told me, &#34;We don&#39;t have onion rings, but those do sound delicious with ranch.&#34; Later on as I was enjoying my meal, the waitress came back with a cup of ranch dressing for me to dip my fries in. They were absolutely divine dipped in ranch dressing. And the best part was, I felt like the waitress actually cared about me because she remembered me talking about ranch dressing earlier for onion rings.<br><br>And on top of the awesome food and services, was the awesome price. Considerably less expensive compared to other restaurants in the inner harbor area.<br><br>The restaurant is located right on the inner harbor, so the view is fantastic. And the atmosphere of the restaurant is also awesome.<br><br>5/5. Very Delicious. Great Service. Awesome Price. Fantastic Experience.

Do not eat here. Save your time and money for something better. They have no concept of quality food or good customer service. I wish I could give negative stars. They have messed up my order twice. Last time I got the Louisiana Pasta which I have ordered several times from other Locations (not in Maryland). It came out looking like an alien, burnt chicken weird colors and no flavor. I said I would never go back but today I had three hours to kill and came in for appetizer I ordered Asian Chive Lettuce wrap. The Lettuce was SPOILED AKA ROTTEN. Brown and Black spots and edges. I think I&#39;ll be reporting them to health dept... I&#39;m so tired of wasting my time, energy and money here.

This is my favorite Cheesecake Factory in B&#39;more. <br><br>I especially like this location because when there is a wait you can walk around in the harbor. The pagers work pretty far.<br><br>The portions are large enough to share. The food is always good and hot and there&#39;s something for everyone. <br><br>Some of my favorite appetizers are the Roadside Sliders, Southern Fried Chicken Sliders and the Firecracker Salmon. <br><br>My favorite specialties are the Ranch House Burger, Steak Diane and the Grilled Shrimp &amp; Bacon Club. <br><br>My favorite cheesecake is the Dulce De Leche Caramel Cheesecake. It is absolutely amazing!  <br><br>My favorite drinks are the Tropical Smoothie and the Frozen Iced Mango.<br><br>They finally offer a kid&#39;s menu. They also offer a complementary baby plate that consists of bananas, oranges and bread.

A New Yorker recommended we go here. She was quite excited and told us it would be worth it. On our way there, she kept raving about the place and saying that we should believe her because she&#39;s from NYC. It was a funny interchange, but I&#39;m glad she convinced us.<br><br>She mentioned that the portion sizes are large. No kidding! Wow. But my friend was right in that the food was exceptional and that you could live for days on the leftovers. Seriously. That was quite handy because my hotel room had a mini fridge, but no room service. When I ate the leftovers in the middle of the night, I was quite grateful. I&#39;m not a huge dessert fan, but the decadence of the chocolate cake was worth it.

Average food, no idea why there is always a wait.  Not like there aren&#39;t dozens of better restaurants in a one mile radius.  Server was VERY good, food was okay, used a gift card so no skin off my back.  Wouldn&#39;t go back and spend my own money.

Had the same dish as my last visit to Cheesecake Factory - The Shrimp and Chicken Gumbo. Have been many times to this chain of restaurants and find this one of the best dishes on the menu. It comprises Shrimp, Chicken, Andouille Sausage, Tomatoes, Peppers, Onions and Garlic Simmered in a Spicy Cajun Style Broth with Cream. Topped with Steamed White Rice.<br><br>And not to forget the basket of bread and butter and the desserts after meal.

We arrived with a large group, and were told the wait was 30 minutes.  Half an hour later, we were seated.  Different types of bread appeared at our table, they worked as an appetizer while we waited for our food.<br><br>I had the shrimp and chicken gumbo.  The andouille sausage pieces were rather small, the shrimp was good, but the whole dish was a little spicier than I would have liked.  Although I would have liked a little more rice, the overall portion size was huge--there was no way I was going to finish all that food.<br><br>Our server was wonderful, he was very attentive.  I had no room for dessert.

Hugely popular chain, but why? I never choose to go here. I&#39;m always going along with friends. I don&#39;t know what the appeal is. It&#39;s always busy, and crowded. The food is never bad, but never that special either. Service for my big group is never tops. This location can have better service in the busy summer months. My last visit was the more typical slow winter service. One in our group had to go get a server.

Save your time and your money! This is the worst Cheesecake Factory ever. It smells of puke and has flies all over the place. The back of the restaurant is aligned with the dumpsters and with a door being right there...the smell is absolutely horrible! My wife and my son went in there to eat, after waiting 21 minutes they sat us. The silverware had left over food on it! The table was not clean! It smelled like vomit! There were flies everywhere! DO NOT EAT HERE!!

Its the Cheesecake Factory so you cant really blow me out of the water with a chain.. the service was decent and it was fairly quiet.. so its Meh.. i&#39;ll always return because its always the same..

Restaurant was extremely busy on Labor Day weekend, about an hour+ wait. After being seated in a booth, I noticed a sour smell througout the booth areas. The place could use a good scrub down though the restaurant was visibly clean. Jade was our server and was very professional and patient/helpful while we selected our orders.
